Reviews.Title: “Great location for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Michelle5250
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that they seem to focus on customer service from initial e-mails checking to see if your require assistance, etc. We were happy with the cleanliness and proximity to Universal Studios and the free shuttle they offer. We upgraded our stay to an Executive Suite. I have to say, for the extra money it cost I wouldn't bother. Basically all it does is get you a living room area and a continental breakfast. The bathroom was still small just like the regular rooms (I think when your check out bill for one night is $350 the bathroom for a suite should be a little more impressive). Also, I can't believe that a suite didn't have a refrigerator??? Our only other complaint, other than the size of the bathroom, was the "Starwood Breakfast" experience. We walked in and only about half the tables were occupied. But the remaining tables that were open were all dirty. And, basically remained dirty with other people's dishes, etc. for the entire time we dined as well. I will say the young man that was working the room was extremely well mannered and well spoken---a great employee. However, he was obviously frazzled trying to keep all the breakfast items stocked as well as trying to keep tables turned over. It really needs two people working it. One to keep the tables clean and turned over quickly as it really is a small room for the amount of people that come through there every day, and one person to keep all the food/beverage items stocked. It's definitely too much to expect one person to manage everything. Other than that, we enjoyed our stay here and obviously the management takes pride in trying to keep their guests accommodated and coming back for future visits...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people WORKING in the hotel! It felt like we were part of the family...”
Reviews.Author: cathuyenoyama
Reviews.Content: My family (myself, husband, 9 y.o. son & mother) recently stayed here for 2 nights on a quick visit to hit The Getty, Universal Studios, WB Studios and Griffith Park. It was mutually convenient to everything, but the MOST IMPORTANT item I wish to mention, is their welcoming staff! They assisted us at every turn - from Chito with our bags, to Ekemo with our reservation to Cassandra with our drinks and lastly Rick San(chez) & Juiet at the buffet breakfast each morning - Tremendous... Lovely... Accommodating! We never dreamt a hotel could feel so much like our neighborhood at home and we cannot wait to return. The rooms were lovely, clean and spacious (we were on the 19th floor) and despite the excitement from all THE VOICE contestants and their families/friends staying there, we didn't hear a peep! (Well, except in the hotel bar... but that part was FUN :)!!!!!) It is a great location - easy exit on/off the freeway and very accessible and reasonable self-parking. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you need to be at Universal City”
Reviews.Author: Nani1212
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for work for three nights. It was walking distance to Universal and to all my meeting with NBCU. The hotel is nice and if you are a preferred guest you get access to the 9th floor that offers a nice and simple breakfast and in the afternoon you get some snacks that are actually very nice. I enjoyed my stay here and will probably stay there again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay & superb customer service!”
Reviews.Author: trinisteph
Reviews.Content: Great rooms & excellent customer service are very important to me and Sheraton Universal exceeded my expectations! I had a work function in the starlight room and opted to spend the night instead of fighting traffic/sleep afterwards. Before checking in, I received a great email from Sherry "Sam" Samanon, the front desk manager, who made sure everything went smoothly when I checked in. I could tell It was going to be a great stay. Jayson provided excellent customer service at check-in and made sure I was satisfied with my room selection. Before heading up to my event, I had a few drinks at the bar and Armando, the bar/catering manager, was extremely friendly & helpful. He made sure they had my drink request upstairs in the starlight room. After the event, I went back downstairs to the lobby bar with some friends and we closed out the bar. Armando also stopped by to see how everything was going....a nice touch! Its always nice to go to a hotel bar, where you can meet a nice mix of locals, tourists and business travelers. The rooms truly live up to the Starwood standard that I've come to expect and I wasn't disappointed. I would recommend staying on a high floor, away from the elevator & ice machine. The views are amazing. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate Stay”
Reviews.Author: Suryjuto
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in the Sheraton Universal laying awake at 4AM with the sliding door to the patio open unable to sleep as the temperature in my room crept to near 80 degrees. I have repeatedly raised a concern to the front desk every morning of my stay regarding the broken air conditioner but have not had any success. It has been quite an unpleasant experience. I have one more night to stay here and I'm actually looking forward to leaving. The hotel staff has not made one attempt to remedy this situation. Very disappointed. Next trip to LA will be in a different hotel. For how much they charge for these rooms, I am appalled at the level an ld quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJMitchell
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel twice now and just got back from my second stay for 10 nights. I was so happy with the experience I had before that I was confident enough to bring my best friend along to stay who had sadly lost his mother recently as a break away trip. We arrived at the hotel and firstly delighted that the hotel has no issue or snobbery about people paying in cash for the duration of their stay provided we either pay for incidentals in advance or guarantee them with a credit card, it was quite a funny moment when with the front desk we were sure we were only staying 9 nights and the concierge said our stay was 10 nights a thrilling game of 3 people counting nights and days on our fingers began (It was our jet lag in the end and we had booked 10 nights). We were given a lovely room on the second floor which at first I was apprehensive about, usually higher the better for me, but my friend LOVED, I mean LOVED the room, centrally overlooked the pool, a wonderful little balcony and easy access to the lobby, pool and dining area. I was actually active this time in wondering how good the room would be on my second trip and to give credit where it is due, the room was SPOTLESS, I ran my hand on lamps, top of frames, furniture, it really is clean. We had two huge beds, which were fresh as a spring meadow.....(after an 11 hour flight ........ just what you want). I did suddenly realise that the bracing bar and internal lock on the outside balcony window was broken, went to reception and an engineer with his trolley was there almost immediately and fixed it within 10 minutes and apologised for the lock not working. With our room deal we were allowed in the club lounge that serves breakfast and hors d'oeuvres, and is served in the club lounge on the 9th floor, the breakfast is continental but we were kindly informed that we could eat in the california restaurant downstairs for breakfast and if we wanted the hot items (scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, hot porridge) we just pay an upgrade of $8, which we found worked great for us as some days you feel like a whole big breakfast, some days not. The hors d'oeuvres served upstairs have a hot dish of some breadcrumbed vegetables or chicken wings but with complimetary soft drinks and nice snacky food (celery, carrots, dips) my healthy eating for the trip! :) Housekeeping was great every day, and made the room up delightfully even though we were quite messy with food and clothes. The reason I like this hotel is the flow and layout, its very nice and bright inside and even though there were 3 conferences there, it was a nice busy not a chaotic busy, I never saw anyone ever complaining at the front desk and generally everyone seemed happy, I think "THE VOICE" contestants or some people related to the show are staying there, and on several nights the hotel is sold out, as 3 people were turned away whilst I was drinking at the bar. The location is wonderful for Universal CityWalk and if you want to kill the walk, its best to walk over to the lifts across the courtyard and go over to the Hilton as that also takes you through a Koi Pond and a beautiful landscaped and lit up area outside their Sierra Ballroom, walk past that and its then just a hop across the street to CityWalk. I had one important meeting at the hotel which soon descended into laughs and informal drinks, which is a big plus here, you can have a formal dinner to a drink by the pool and the hotel lends itself well to its different areas of dining and socialising. The pool area is lovely, I was nicely surprised that the water uses as little chlorine as possible so you dont get that "pool" smell, there isnt a pool service as someone waiting on you hand and foot, but the restaurant is right next to it and would bring you out whatever you ordered. Another major plus is that it is open 24 hours a day so a late night swim or jacuzzi is always an option which is very nice as both are lit up. Its a strange thing to rave about but their computer centre, is a lovely warm and bright workspace right round the corner and a great place where people are meeting as well as doing work, unlike other hotels, it is not held behind bulletproof glass and 70 combination locks in some dreary corner of the hotel, instead its big open desks that produce a lovely working enviroment at any time of day or night and there is a big TV adjacent to watch the news and sports. One lady was moaning there was no scanner but had just printed (FOR FREE) all her papers, yes FREE printing!!! Yes they dont have a scanner, but in this lady eyes the hotel also fails on points for not having a direct link to the International Space Station or having Shamu the Whale in the outdoor pool. As long as the rates stay the same and I get the same level of service, I would go to this hotel again, cant fault. Chris Mitchell, London

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE PLACE/MANAGER IS UNPROFESIONAL”
Reviews.Author: Marybeatles
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation to stay at this hotel, and then my daughter got sick. I had spoken to the manager when I re booked. He promised me that he would take care of it completely, and that he would call me back. For about weeks, I waited and called, without a call back. and then when I finally got him on the phone, he promised he would make my reservation and call me back the next day, or by Monday. Well, its Tuesday. I called him today and he could not care less that he did not make the reservation yet, and when I told him that I was not happy with the way he treated me, he said, "fine". I said he could forget about me staying at his hotel. He was fine with that too. I told him that it just confirmed what I thought of him, and that he does not know how to treat people. I wanted you to know what kind of person is managing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ill mannered Manager”
Reviews.Author: ErichHWoodlandHills
Reviews.Content: On a trip to support my daughter in a beauty pageant several weeks ago, I stayed in the Sheraton Universal where I had a very bad experience. To make a long story short, a waiter got our check mixed up with another check. The problem, mistakes happen, the problem was, the other person's card had already been entered, and my bill charged to their account. The other patron had complained, how they didn't have a lot of money, because my check bill was 4 times what they should have paid. The problem was the Manager, Mr. Coss, insulted the other patron, by telling them they were poor...and something to the fact, they shouldn't be eating here at the Sheraton. This was very uncalled for and insulted the other patron. I believe managers should have more respect for customers. I will return to the Sheraton, however; I hope that Manager receives some Management Training.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Universal”
Reviews.Author: pmb2934d
Reviews.Content: Good location. Convenient to freeways and Universal City Walk and Universal Studios. There is a free tram to the above locations that is supposed to run every 10-15 minutes but is solely based on the driver schedule for breaks and meals so you may wait up to 45 minutes like we did. The hotel staff is not upfront about possible delays. They state that they don't control the transportation so they are not responsible for the timing-very poor attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Fordb
Reviews.Content: My holiday company booked two standard rooms which we needed one of the rooms to be a double but the request did not get to the hotel. Being Easter the hotel was full. Really helpful staff arranged a put-u-up bed for our first night and the next day arranged a twin room on the same floor as our other room all free of charge. Rooms were good (really nice beds thinking about ordering one from Sheraton!) and had spectacular views looking over LA (fl16). One night the next door room occupants came back at 3.00am with all of their friend and stayed up talking for ages keeping us awake and yes the walls are quite thin. (Still the next day the do not disturb sign disappeared off their door!) Very helpful staff the concierge could not do enough for us including information on trips and directions and sights to see. For Breakfast we had a voucher as part of our package. The selection was ok but by morning five it was a bit repetitive. Little annoying thing was no rubbish bin for the empty cereal packets. Universal is not that far away but is uphill so we took the free regular bus from the hotel and walked back. All in all a real good stay and would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay at universal”
Reviews.Author: maggot65
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights whilst visiting Universal studios. Reception personell were friendly but the room was a bit cramped although the beds were comfortable. Club room was undersized so both mornings we had to wait for a table to get our breakfast. That is just not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, food, and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Lois2272
Reviews.Content: We stayed during a family vacation. Breakfast was served long enough that teenagers could actually eat. The hotel is within walking distance of Universal (there is also a shuttle) and is convenient to Hwy 101. Rooms are very clean, beds wonderful. What really made the difference was the staff. Very helpful with any little problem or question about amusement parks. We stayed in the lanai rooms, excellent view of the pool and made it seem like a much smaller hotel (we never took the elevator during our 4 day stay). We didn't get breakfast included in our room rate, and that was a mistake. We found that it would have been cheaper to book through the hotel rather than hotels.com, but that's hardly the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location-nice hotel-try to get a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: Gregoryg63
Reviews.Content: I walked into the beautiful lobby and looked for things that my kids might break. There were 4sl separate check-in counters with 2 stations each and only 1 person working all of them. It was a bit frustrating but once past that our family just loved the room and the view from the 18th floor overlooking the hills. We took the shuttle to Universal studios, a 3 minute ride, and had a blast all day and then came back and relaxed in our very nice room. My gripes were that the restaurant seemed a little outdated. I don't want to pay $21 for an adult Buffet and $11 for kids. In fairmess, there were cheaper alternatives in the lobby. Also, I had to pay for Internet (one of my pet peeves). If I have to pay for Internet it should work everywhere. It did not work in the plaza level where the restaurant was. But don't get me wrong, everything else was excellent. Next time I will negotiate a better rate and try to get Internet and parking included.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: jk566
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at the Sheraton and had a fantastic stay. Everyone we dealt with from reservations through check out was very accommodating and service oriented. We upgraded to a junior suite package which included parking and breakfast each day and was worth the additional cost. The room was updated and very clean and comfortable. The location was very convenient to Universal Studios, Hollywood, and other great LA attractions, but you will need a car. The only downside was the elevator issues, but not a big deal. Thanks for a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Oakleigh22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights (2 adults and 3 teenagers). Hotel staff were friendly and the rooms were of a good standard. The breakfast was also good but the restaurant can get a bit crowded. Universal studios and city walk is just 10 minutes walk away. LA traffic can be a bit of a nightmare, so use the metro which is just 5 minutes for from the hotel. We used it to go to the staples center and to the Kodak theatre and could not fault it ($1.50 for single journey or $5 for a day pass). Other reviewers have stated have a room facing the pool to avoid traffic noise, we had a room on the opposite side to the pool and we could not hear any traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Universal”
Reviews.Author: ddclean
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very clean. It's not like the Universal Hotels in Orlando, but for convenience to Universal Hollywood - perfect. Everyone we had dealing with was very courteous and friendly. The Valet Service was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: gfgb78
Reviews.Content: I stay have stayed at this hotel several times over the past few months and the service is always amazing. The valet, front desk, restaurant, and club lounge staff are all very responsive and friendly. This hotel is very clean and is a great location. This is great hotel for both business and personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here a night because the Hilton next door was over sold. The rooms here are very small compared to the Hilton. Upon arrival, valet and bellman was pleasant but the front desk. Staff are not. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: hixona
Reviews.Content: We had booked a different hotel for this part of our vacation and it did not work out. The Sheraton was able to give us 2 nights during a very busy spring break and saved our vacation. Emecka checked us in and turned our frowns upside down. The room was clean and quiet. It overlooked the pool and we were able to see the Next Top Models line up for auditions, which was fun. The rooms on our floor were having new room photos and mirrors installed at the time we were there, but they were quick. Starbucks coffee in-room and in the lobby. Convenient shuttle to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: anapin
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Sheraton Universal. At this time, we had a Club Lounge room and we could see the hotel was remodeled , but the staff still do an excellent job. From your arrival, the front desk people, the concierge and everybody that works there pamper you . If you need an information, they give you a complete map, explaining very well all the stuff you need. The breakfast was fair, with eggs, ham, cheeses, breads and muffins, coffee, tea and juices. Also they offer cereals and fresh fruits. You really don't need to have breakfast anywhere else. On the other hand, the happy hour - between 5;30 and 7;00 P.M. - is good if you don't drink alcohol. Soft drinks are free but you have to pay (and it's expensive) for any glass of wine or beer. As we can see, it's an unhappy hour.... But the appetizers were very good, mainly the shrimp appetizer.... Also to get the Port of Los Angeles you have to do a long trip - more than 50 minutes ! and if you call the Supershuttle, you have to go first to the Airport, and then, to the Port... The best thing is: you are almost facing the Universal Studios Hollywood! So, you can choose different things for dining and you don't need to have a ticket to go to Citywalk... If you like the rides, you can spend the whole day for fun... At Citywalk you can shop and dine, isn't lovely? The real problem we had at the hotel was with neighbors screaming, running and slamming doors at 1:30 A.M. I tried to knock the wall, asking for silence and they began knocking the wall like mad people. I called the reception and less than one minute ( the time to get the lift) I've heard the security calling the neighbors and I've got silence to sleep... I liked very much the readiness of the security...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wild_Orchidz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute walk from Universal Studios and the City Walk. Guest service was impressive. Rooms were beautiful. Location fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Pickyguests
Reviews.Content: Just checked in the room. CARPET: is run down with lots of wear and tear and spots! GLASSon the dresser is shattered on edges, BATHROOM :full of hair ( prob. Previous guest's hair ) DUST on everything ; phone, alarm , doors, dressers and Tv!! Hidden wires indside closets !!!! Major major disappointment ! We called the front desk to change the room and they said that our room was renovated !!! The room is beyond disappointing , thumbs down to the cleaning crew that can ruin a hotel's reputation in a second !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Paypay14
Reviews.Content: Loved our Stay at the Sheraton Universal City. The staff was wonderful, the lobby is fun and hip. Lots of space to just hang out and relax outside of your room. The restaurant down stairs was wonderful. They have a great breakfast buffet, $21.00 adult, $11.00 for kids 12 and under. Wonderful service (Thanks Roman and Julieanne) It is walking distance to city walk and universal, the sub station is right at the bottom of the hill. Close to everything in LA. I have stayed at the Hilton in the past, but the atmosphere here was way more my style and If they continue to treat guest as well as they treated us they will do well.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the first time”
Reviews.Author: DrDSM
Reviews.Content: I returned again for a yearly convention. Last year I had only one complaint about a dirty bed. This year everything was not just better it was remarkably better. The room was very clean and the staff was the most pleasant I have EVER experienced. Every single staff member was cheery and honestly cared. Not the fake smile one is often greeted with. Another surprise was the prepared lunch. I had the veggie option and it was delicious. Two things to watch out for; 1 is the elevators. Sometimes the traffic gets very heavy and it might take a while to catch one. Just plan ahead. 2. When the outside temperature drops below 53F, the A/C turn into a heater. This doesn't make a lot of sense since the windows don't open and the room temperature then becomes over 80F at 3 a.m. Kudos to the manager and staff for exceeding my expectations by a long shot. But please update the A/C situation.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay when visiting Universal studios”
Reviews.Author: jacqui o
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here and the staff were very welcoming. We stayed in the club level which included breakfast. The breakfast was good but there were not enough seats/tables for all the guests- it got very crowded. The pool is adequate and kept the children happy for an hour or so. The location is also a winner- you can walk from the hotel to Universal Studios and Universal city and hotel parking is reasonable. Our first experience in a Sheraton hotel and after this I would definately stay in a Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: shells13
Reviews.Content: The staff here were fantastic. Friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a lovely suite, room 1503. Bed was comfy, and so were the pillows. Bar area serves snacks till quite late, which was great for us as we were late flying in (9:00 p.m.) Prices for food were very reasonable also. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 teenage sons stayed at this location for 2 nights in March '12. Having stayed at many Sheraton's all over NA I was unsure what the service level would be like in a tourist location being next door to a theme park. We were literally pampered at every level of contact within the property. Breakfast staff were attentive and cheerful. Evening drinks in the lounge (just mom and dad of course) was terrific and the staff again was very social and fun. Business center was state of the art and even the hotel wifi worked well. The rooms were clean, beds very comfortable, and I loved the shower head so much I am changing mine at home. A special shout out to one of the front desk managers, Sam. She took great care of us and made us feel like we were more important than anyone else. I found it impressive because in a property that boasts high turnover day to day it takes a dedicated team member to make people feel that way in such a short time frame. Thank you Sam and we are already talking about when our next trip there will be. Regardless of whether we visit universal we will stay at this Sheraton. Regards, Gary, Shelley, Justin & Jordan.

Reviews.Title: “Update on our stay in November 2011”
Reviews.Author: swills9
Reviews.Content: Just a quick update on our review for November 2011, having been in contact with the Manager (Randy) he has promised to make sure we will be OK next time, which will be Feb 2013! Will keep you to this Randy, I see in one of the replies he says it is a 'secure' car park, sadly not 'that' secure, on our last visit, our rental car had the number plate (licence plate) bent upwards by 90 degrees, not much, but annoying all the same, but we did not mention it, when we took it back, the rental co, did ask, but we said we knew nithing about it, and must have been in a supermarket! Hoping for a really nice room next time (Randy !!!) nive and high with a good view, this Hotel can't be that bad, although we have had 'issues' this will be our 5th or 6th stay with them :-)

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: Stewart C
Reviews.Content: It is simple but nice, with a great lobby and bar. The fitness area is huge and new but the pool was less than amazing. My room was clean and had a great view of the valley and the theme park across the way. The entire staff was very friendly and outgoing. I will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “SECOND TO NONE....AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie L
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation in almost eight years. We had a lot to celebrate and wanted our vacation to be as memorable and perfect as possible. My husband and I were celebrating our up and coming 32 year anniversary and our children's excellent achievement in school. We knew nothing about Los Angeles and spent weeks looking over trip advisor reviews, location, convenience, and cost; a very daunting task. We finally chose the Sheraton Universal Hotel for the location, which was walking distance from Universal Studios. The photos of the hotel were very appealing. The hotel had all of the amenities that we were looking for and the price was very reasonable. When we arrived at the hotel, we were overwhelmed with the beauty of the front lobby. Everything from the gorgeous orchids, the comfortable and beautifully decorated lounge/bar to the wonderful scent, too beautiful not to notice, that filled the lobby. Check in was a breeze and after mentioning that we had been travelling for 12 hours, the gentleman at the front desk did not hesitate to provide us with complimentary beverages. The rooms were perfectly sized and the queen beds were the most comfortable hotel beds that we have ever encountered. The linens were divine, especially the duvet. We really appreciated the complimentary toiletries in the bathroom, especially the bath sponges, Q-tips, nail file and cotton balls. Our family took full advantage of the exercise room, with all of its toning and cardio machines and the beautiful outdoor pool and hot tub. The one area of hospitality that this hotel offered over any other is their housekeeping option. For every day that you chose not to have your room cleaned, you were given a $5.00 voucher that could be used for food/drinks (non alcoholic) anywhere in the hotel, including room service. We saved up our vouchers and ordered room service one evening. The pancakes and cheesecake were excellent and all free with our vouchers!! Honestly, I cannot say enough about this hotel; I could go on and on. The hotel and the staff were AMAZING and SECOND TO NONE. The staff, every single one of them from concierge to housekeeping were simply the best. The employees were so friendly and helpful. We were actually overwhelmed at how friendly and helpful they were and the attention that they applied to every detail of our trip. THE SERVICE IS SIMPLY INCOMPARABLE!!! My advice..... stay at the Sheraton Universal. Don't look anywhere else because there is nothing better. Whether you have small children or teenagers, this hotel and its staff will ensure that your stay is the very best. You will be sad to leave and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Universal”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: During a recent stay in LA we spent time at 3 different Sheraton hotels. This one was the best. It had the most comfortable (newest?) beds and was very convenient to area attractions. While checking in I mentioned to the desk clerk that I needed to ship souveniers home. Without my asking he immediately googled a local FedEx storefront location and printed driving directions for me. This little step was a very nice touch that really helped me. My wife was also very impressed with this hotel and we both would stay there again if in the area. She agreed it was the nicest one we stayed at during our vacation, even though it appeared to be the oldest of the three. It was well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ITGOA
Reviews.Content: Pros: The best thing about this hotel is it's proximity to Universal Studios and Citywalk. A 5-10 minute walk, or there is a shuttle which we did not try. The Hilton is actually 2 minutes closer. Would stay here again for this reason alone. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We overlooked the pool with a balcony, not sure if this was an upgrade or not for SPG status, the check in person was not particularly forthcoming. We were also given Club Floor access when I asked, which translates to a continental breakfast in quite a busy room. Rooms are well furnished though on the small side. Cons: There is essentially a $30 a night surcharge to stay here. $18 for parking (not discussed at check in) and $10 for internet - with taxes is $30. I hate being nickel and dimed.

Reviews.Title: “No better than average”
Reviews.Author: mkhmn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference but brought along family. The only claim to fame is the proximity to Universal Studios and to get there on foot you have to take an iffy elevator up to the Hilton Hotel next door and walk through their ballroom area to get outside. Crazy. The elevator stuck twice while we were there. Not good. Checked in and the room was ready. No washcloths so immediately called down for some - they never arrived. Next morning called again and finally got some. No extra toilet paper so we were very careful. LOL Concierge was helpful and sold us Universal Studios tickets with no fuss. They have a Starbucks "outpost" in the lobby, but it's part of their actual bar. The person didn't make drinks, just pointed me to the filled canisters lining the booth and I made my own. Weird. The restaurant downstairs has a breakfast buffet that I really enjoyed. It was pricey, but the waitstaff was incredibly nice. Told the kids what they should do at Universal Studios and in what order and they were right! The restaurant makes their own salsa, so if you go, be sure to ask for that - it was phenomenal! I put it on the scrambled eggs from the buffet and really really loved it. Buffet had just about everything you'd want and ended up being cheaper than ordering off the menu. Probably wouldn't stay here again, but wasn't horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Universal Studios, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: VacationsAreSoFun
Reviews.Content: Was here for a function, not for Universal, but it's literally at Universal Studio's front door. Cons: Steep price, plus minimum $19/day for self parking. Pay for wifi Pros: - Most rooms will have some type of a view. The 18th flr had an amazing view of the area - Modern, well furnished rooms with comfy beds and pillows - Great suites and jr. suites with large open spaces - Starbucks coffee for the in room coffee makers - Extra in room portable fan despite good HVAC system - Restaurant and breakfast bar downstairs - Easy freeway access

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, great location for universal and surrounding la area”
Reviews.Author: kenuga
Reviews.Content: Used points: Starwood gold member. Hotel was pretty large, heated outdoor pool kids enjoyed. Requested high room with view., was honored. Room 1608. Rooms seemed to have been updated and were comfortable for our family of 4. Walked and took free van to universal city walk.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: vamartinez05
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here in a suite and it was amazing! The room was big considering we have a 15 month old baby. Plenty of room for him to run around. Great views from the 14th floor. The pool was great temperature considering the weather was cold. Close to Universal City Walk and Universal Studios which we walked to both days. This is our second time here, and we will always continue to come back here each time we are in the area. The managers and staff are very helpful and always there to assist. Thank you again Sheraton for making our stay again memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Facelift Please”
Reviews.Author: Whis117
Reviews.Content: in the land of plastic surgery and re-inventing oneself, why oh why can't the Sheraton Universal get a little love. The front desk staff was awesome, but the rooms are completely dated, bathrooms are microscopic and the place actually kind of smells bad! As I said , the staff is wonderful and try to overcome the condition of the property. The place simply needs an update - please - spend a buck on paint and carpet...

Reviews.Title: “Decent Sheraton next to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Ming_Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in February 2012. Hotel is conveniently located next to Universal Studios, very easy access from the highway, good parking facilities, and offers pretty nice views on both sides. We enjoyed a very large double queen room on the 12th floor, probably a Club Room (we are SPG Platinum members). Bathroom in comparison was extremely small, and offered very limited amenities. We were quite disappointed by the Club Lounge, where we had breakfast, with very average selection of food, terrible coffee, not even expresso nor capuccino. The staff was quite friendly and welcoming (reception, concierge, butler at the lounge).

Reviews.Title: “Redone Hotel at Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: raysb
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been remodeled and is very nicely appointed, large pool good fitness facility walk or shuttle to Universal Studios Citywalk for a good selection of shopiing and restaurants. Convenient to Hollywood or downtown LA. Close to Burbank airport. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ruthfa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Feb 2012. We arrived at 2345 at night after a lond flight and there was no food availiable within the hotel (not even a vending machine). Front desk suggested we send out for pizza. We were assigned a room that the reception staff assured us was one of their better rooms as it had a balcony. On arrival at the room the main thing we noticed was the noise from the freeway outside the balcony (not sure why you would ever want to sit on it and overlook the traffic). The problem was that the glass patio window was not airtight and not at all soundproofed so the noise from the freeway was loud at all times. We phoned back to reception and asked if there was an alternative room availiable. We were told that no, the whole hotel was fully booked out. We were also told that we should be grateful for having the balcony as people who were higher up were always complaining it was too hot and the air conditioning did not work - at least we were able to cool the room down via the badly fitting windows. We then wondered what kind of run down place we were staying at. The room itself was great, really comfy bed, lots of storage and a good bathroom. Breakfast was adequate though the buffet area was very small (for the size of the hotel) and continously ran out of stuff. Service was erratic, one morning we were waiting so long for our drinks we had already finished the food. Its an OK place, the room is comfortable. Just avoid the traffic facing rooms with the balcony (on ground level floor 3) or the hot rooms in the tower (as reception suggested). Free wireless internet was a bonus also.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of the stars?”
Reviews.Author: RustyRobear
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if real stars have actually stayed here, but it was good enough for me. The proximity to CityWalk and Universal Studios was nice for getting out and away from the hotel during free time (I was there for work). I don't know when the rooms were remodeled, but they still had a pretty fresh feeling to them. The lobby was also very nice and good for hanging out in groups. I thought that we would have been a little closer to actual "Hollywood" attractions, but they were only a short ride away. I'd stay at the Sheraton Universal again if I was in the area for any reason, or if I wanted to take my family to Universal Studios during a SoCal vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Deal breakers.”
Reviews.Author: Evan559
Reviews.Content: Remodeled lobby and updated rooms had us feeling peetty good about our choice...until we made it to our room. We found a dirty toilet (brown splatter under the seat and inside the bowl...gag!) and all the pleasant sounds of the 101 Freeway - literally steps from or window - to sing us to sleep. According to the front desk staff, the entire hotel was sold out and there was no other room to move us to. Will not be returning or recommending this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: nhhk
Reviews.Content: A short walk to Universal, and short distance to many of the sights makes this an excellent place to stay. The rooms are clean and functional. The staff friendly. The staff did more than you'd expect from a Sheraton. The room I was in had a noisy neighbour and the staff went out of their way to move me. Then checked the next couple of days to be sure. The only negative comment about the whole place was that the bar served the worst gin and tonic I've ever had anywhere. Won't take much to fix that! I look forward to staying again next time I'm in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice Sheraton hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManDanny
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at Sheraton Universal after a couple days in Disneyland and our engagment! A great stay this hotel has a beautiful lobby, free internet via wireless or desktop in their Link@ setup in the lobby. Nice restaurant for breakfast, lunch, dinner and room service. Universal is about a five minute walk away so fine if the weather's fine, otherwise there is a shuttle bus that runs from Universal. I wouldn't say the walk is any farther from Sheraton than Hilton though. We were up on the 16th floor facing north in a corner suite. Nice view and enjoyable surroundings. Clean and well presented room. The bed was amazing!! Best sleep we had had all trip. Went for a swim the next morning but it was pouring and pool/hot tub is outside so that brought an end to that! Perfect Starwood stay - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tom1c
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Hotel with fantastic surroundings easy access to the metro train system nice rooms nice breakfast very friendly staff couldn't have asked for more would love to go back and stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and "Sam" for taking care of me and my daughter...”
Reviews.Author: maritez
Reviews.Content: We went there from January 14-16. My daughter and I wanted to stay close to Universal Studios for our long weekend getaway. I mentioned when I reserved for the room that we will be arriving late, so when we got to the reception there was Pancho forgot his last name. He seemed like he had a long day because he was in a hurry to get us checked in. I asked him if he could give us a nice view since it was our first time... he said yes yes.. when we got up to the 11th floor ... it turned out we got the freeway view.. not very nice. He spoke so fast, at 8pm.. after a long day of traveling, you cannot comprehend everything he is saying. Then I said until what time does the tram run.. he quickly replied..9 pm.. The night before I got an email from Chris Murdoch and he cc'd the other managers stating that if there is anything I need to notify them. I emailed the managers and I got a quick response from Sam. She was quick enough to take care of me and my daughter. I have stayed at Sheraton Anaheim, Sheraton Norfolk, other Sheraton properties and I must say you have an excellent staff.. esp Sam. except for Pancho. The other plus is the fact that the tram drops you off at the City Walk away from all the crowds. You have your own drop off spot. The breakfast buffet was excellent as well. Breakfast staff are excellent service as well. I highly recommend staying at Sheraton Universal. Thank you so much to everyone and especially to Sherry "Sam"

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jin H
Reviews.Content: We actually checked out of another hotel to come to Sheraton but were very disappointed- should have stayed put where we were. We paid for a room that was supposed to be a more 'desirable' room because it had a balcony facing the pool- we were told by the reception " people pay more for this room". Firstly, to get to the room, one has to go up some 4-5 steps or so- there are no elevators to go to this part of the hotel- not good if you have some heavy luggages. Upon entering the room, we noted the carpet was stained in several areas (see pic). We then realized the wood panel on the door frame to the toilet was almost falling off (see pic). We went back to reception to ask for a different room but was told there were no other rooms available that were equivalent to the price of the room we paid. We were offered a room without a balcony but there will be no refund or upgrades. The receptionist went to speak with his supervisor and came back with nothing except the reassurance that his supervisor will follow up with us; of course no one followed up during our 2 night stay! The parking is shabby not attached to the hotel, you have to walk across a lane to the hotel for $15/night and the parking elevator smelt of urine. Room comes with 3 towels- there were 4 of us (2 kids) and so we asked housekeeping for more towels- they were prompt and brought us 4 extra towels but unfortunately 3 out of 4 towels were heavily stained (see pics). It was disgusting, adding to our disappointment. The only good thing was it's location if you are going to Universal Studios. You will be within walking distance to US. We were very disappointed especially considering it was a Sheraton. Will not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: downAMDsouth
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, the hotel was nice, clean and friendly staff. The Room was spacious,beds was great. 4 Adults were comfortable in this room. Our View was very good, you could see Hollywood Blvd.(at nite the lights looked great) the hills in a distant, down delow you can see the different studios. The Location was a plus!!! All the attraction were just a short walk. Room service was good, food (breakfast) fresh, hot. Staff at front desk very friendly, most helpful. Yes, I would love to stay again. P.S. the hill was great walking excerise. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCWife
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is quite out of the way for most So Cal attractions, if you're going to Universal and don't mind being out of the way, it can be the perfect spot. A shuttle is by every 10 minutes during the day to take you to Universal and City Walk where restaurants, shops and attractions abound. The hotel itself is very clean, a little old, but well maintained. Rooms are spacious and updated, the lobby is large and the lobby bar is a great place to grab a cocktail and appy before heading out (especially for happy hour during the week)!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lumbarlover
Reviews.Content: Chikodi Anotnio the front desk manager made this stay a wonderful one. A buddy of mine and I were upgraded to a room with the complimentary lounge. We qualified for a special rate which we did not book as planned. Chikodi helped me figure out how to get that rate online and was very helpful in the process. Many places try to squeeze out every dime from you but I did not experience this in the slightest from the Sheraton. Coveniently located to Universal and if your a person that likes public transportation the transit station is down the hill. Also parked my car there to save $.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the location, but in need of a renovation”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiShu
Reviews.Content: Obviously close to Universal Studios, but not much to offer beyond that. We stayed in a junior suite which was nothing more than a regular room with some oddly placed extra space added on ('L' shaped room). Rooms are run down and in need of a renovation. Service seemed alright - with one exception. In the club lounge, watched a kid playing with the ice cubes intended for drinks with his hands and then putting them back in the bucket The club lounge attendant also watched this. I would have thought that the attendant would have changed out the ice? Nope. Needless to say, warm drinks that night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Members”
Reviews.Author: BigD19
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at this hotel and was very impressed with the level of service from all staff members. From check-in late on a Saturday night til checkout on Christmas morning everyone was totally responsive - front desk, valet, housekeeping, buffet attendants, even parking lot attendants. If I asked for something it was handled within 10 minutes. The only complaints would be the noise from the toilet tank running on and off all night long and the $18 per night for self parking (a bit high). They did do a repair to the toilet which helped but keeping the door closed at night handled the noise problem. The breakfast buffet (Club level) was good with sufficient choices and the staff there was very accommodating. Had some very pleasant conversation with several staff members and they never made me feel rushed. The room was decent size (very small closet) with a very comfortable king bed. The views of Universal City and the San Fernando valley were outstanding. Again, very impressive and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Yups89
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night (dec 28 - 30) stay with my wife and kid. Staff were courteous, the size of the room is ok but the t&b is a bit small. One major complaint however is their aircon. Especially during the wee hours of the morning, both nights my wife and I woke up because the aircon is simply not enough to cool the room. Maybe that is the reason why they have a small fan inside the closet. I have read a complaint from another site with the same problem. The thing we like most about the hotel is the great location. Easy walk to Universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service ruined my entire stay”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa D
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here late September of last year. It our first time in a long time going to Hollywood and Universal Studios. My sister paid for our room as an anniversary present to us. She told me that she paid with a credit card and gave me a form with her signatures & card number & attached was a copy of the card & her license. I go up to the counter to check in- but couldn't. Because there was one signature missing on the form. I had to call my sister and have her fax the hotel another copy of the form. After about 30 minutes of asking the "front desk manager" if she had received the copy & her answer no, I called my sister again and she told me that she has sent 3 TIMES. Another 30 minutes went by & the front desk manager comes out with multiple copies of the form that she received and said that she didn't want to check me in because the form was "illegible". I looked at the form(s) and its not my fault that the printer was out of ink/toner. Iwas so annoyed and upset with this woman. She said she'll go ahead and check me in "BUT wants a clearer form sent to her before I check out." I have never worked in the hotel, so I don't know the importance of ONE signature. But I have worked in customer service & I would think especially at a hotel you would want to make your guests feel as comfortable as possible. My whole day was ruined. We were suppose to stay for 3 days, but we checked out the next morning. I will never again be staying at Sheraton Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about at all”
Reviews.Author: sambas2
Reviews.Content: great view - on the valley side very convenient location - 7 minute walk to universal studios/citywalk...or can wait for a free shuttle every 15 minutes. Close to Burbank airport, and hollywood. 2 minor complaints: prices of food and parking were a bit steep. For example, Self-park was $18/night, my bottle of soda in the gift shop was $3 + tax.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location, and gym!!”
Reviews.Author: DWfromNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at a VERY busy time of the year. The first room that we were given had a minor problem which I reported to the front desk with a request for another room. We were given a lovely upgraded room for our trouble and in addition we received breakfast vouchers. I was very impressed with how the front desk staff handled the issue. I also received an email the following day asking if everything was OK and if there was anything they could do to improve our visit. The front desk staff on Thursday DEc 29th was excellent. In addition ALL of the staff were extremely courteous and friendly througout our stay. We wanted to stay an additional day but the hotel was sold out. The gym was clean, there was a variety of equipment, and we did not have to wait to use any of the equipment. The location is great expecially if you plan to visit Citywalk or Universal. We were visiting a relative in Hollywood which is right over the hill...about 10 minutes by car. We will definitely stay here again next year but I will book earlier so I can get the extra night. Also concierge was very helpful on Friday Morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel for visiting studios”
Reviews.Author: Cliff S
Reviews.Content: The strongest point of the hotel is the fantastic location. It is a very comfortable 10 minute walk from the studios. Yes this isn't the cheapest hotel but the standard is excellent and the location is really worth paying a premium for. The room was first rate with a great view over the studios. We actually got a really good deal booking online but I notice that for other dates it was much more expensive. Highly recommended for families visiting universal studios. Very convenient for subway and the drive into Hollywood was much quicker than I had expected to be so can also be used as a base for visiting LA more generally. All in all a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Always an enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sheraton Universal a few times throughout the summer and fall of 2011. Each and every time, I have found the staff to be exceptional! Although the price per night is a bit more than I would prefer, I find the location convenient, and the hotel always clean and well presented which keeps me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Glendale”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights while on business in Glendale. Bed was very comfortable, I had a great view from the 17th floor. Room was very bright, lots of natural light - which I loved. Front desk staff were friendly, housekeeping does a great job. Room was very clean and smelled great. Towels were bright white. Overall a very nice stay. Gift shop in the lobby is also open late and has snacks, toiletries and souveniers. They also gave me internet for free since it was my first time staying here - very nice! I will certainly return on my next trip to the area. I also discovered on my last night that there is a small shopping center around the corner (Riteaid/CVS, gourmet grocery, Starbucks and some small shops.) Very convenient place for breakfast/coffee and take out.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but greatly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: James L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in December, Great staff during check-in and during my stay. However the prices are out of control. Visiting Universal Studios there are really only two hotels to choose from for walking distance, this one and the Hilton, the Hilton is cheaper. Here at the Sheraton it is $18/night to self-park and $24 + tip for valet. I had requested a mini-fridge for my room which was never delivered. When getting hungry I thought about room service but saw that it would cost about $29 for a bowl of oatmeal and a glass of milk. No thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: albertc9
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to Los Angeles and stayed here for a week. From the moment we stepped onto the property we were treated exceptionally well by every staff member we encountered. A big thanks, in particular, to Sam who checked us in and gave us much more than we expected! We chose one of the Lanai rooms overlooking the pool area but looking back, I would've chosen a Tower room since it was rather cold on many days and couldn't take advantage of the balcony. The room itself was cozy and clean but we noticed the fire detector was missing with just a jumble of wires hanging out of the wall. It was quiet most nights so we had a restful sleep except for one night where one of neighbors were getting a bit, uhhhh, intimate rather loudly. The location can't be beat for what we were looking to do. The shuttle is extremely convenient and handy to get to Universal Studios and CityWalk since it can get a little tiring walking up the steep hill. Other areas of the city were easily accessible with the Metro Rail and a transit centre at the bottom of the hill. And the Club Lounge provided a fantastic continental breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvre with a great view of the area from the 9th floor. The staff did a great job ensuring there was plenty of food and drink available and the tables cleared promptly. Overall this is a fantastic hotel with friendly staff and would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location for vacation”
Reviews.Author: Redhead_099
Reviews.Content: Even if you are not going to Universal Studios (we did not) this is a great location with one caveat. There is a very very steep hill from the hotel to the metro. The sign says 13% grade. Walking up, it felt like 45% grade. We walked up for the exercise a few days. Other days we took the shuttle up hill. There is a daily shuttle 7am-7pm (at the bottom of the hill/across the street from the metro station) that takes you to Universal City Walk/studios. There is an easy path 5 minute walk to the Hilton Hotel with an elevator down to the Sheraton. With a 5 minute downhill walk to the Red Line metro station, this location worked out great for us. It is one stop to Hollywood & Highland where all of the main tourist attractions are located. We took the 217 bus from there to Farmers Market, The Forum, and CBS studios for a taping of a late night TV show. The hotel room itself was average with a small bathroom. I also noticed the fan in the closet another guest mentioned. We stayed during the winter and were looking for another blanket. We called guest services who called maintenance to get the heat turned on. After that all was fine. We did the old trick of filling up the ice bucket with water to keep the room comfortable. There was several children next door and we heard them through the walls. We just turned up the TV to drown them out. We skipped room cleaning one day to earn a 500 points credit. We cashed in our points to pay for the room so all in all I can't complain. Other rooms in the chain had a high school across the street or a noisy night club. This seemed to be the best of the Starwood chain. As a Gold Starwood member with an upgrade to the club level included; I would recommend this location. The club level earns you 2 bottled water in the room, nightly h'orderves, continental breakfast, and fruit and more bottled water daily in the club room on the 9th floor. This is a category 4 hotel on the Starwood sight.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, still room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: swills9
Reviews.Content: Had our 3rd or 4th stay at the Sheraton in November this year (2011), we were in two minds about styaing here after our last stay which was both noisy and during a 'convention' noisy and on our landing a smell of alcohol! ( 2 nights) This time however the roonm was quite with a nice view from the (it has to be said) rather dirty window, looks like it had not been cleaned for some few months, not that easy I suppose 11 floors up. Again at the end of the week, there was some sort of convention, and we were kept up until 0245 in the morning with laughing and doors slamming shut, this was mentioned to the desk who did apologise. The other thing that annoyed me, and one of the reasons we went back to this Hotel, after the last trip, we had a letter saying that we would be given a free entry to UNIVERSAL, this latter was emailed back to them a couple of weeks before went, but the desk knew nothing, and the offer was never given to us. Parking was about $20 per night, but even as guests you do not get priority/resevered areas, thus on a few nights when events were on, we ended up on the very top deck squeezing in, and on one moring, some nice person had bent out licence plate through 90 degrees... why ? ! Would i stay again, possibly, it is handy for City Walk and the Freeway (101) Rooms are clean, Staff are very freindly, it's the little things that can really spoil the vacation,

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: DrStuo
Reviews.Content: First the good: it is a great location and a beautiful hotel and we got a good price thru an internet site. Checkin desk service was top notch and we got a nice room on the 18th floor with a million dollar view of the San Fernando Valley. But: the bathroom was very compact, the bed felt very comfortable when I first lay down but I woke with a severe back ache. The room was too hot all night long despite the fact the air conditioner was working. In the morning my wife noticed that there was a portible fan in the closet which leads me to believe other tourists had complained about it being too hot and our discovery was too late to help us. Neither of us got a good night's sleep. Note that self parking costs $18 a day and there is No street parking available. You do have in and out priveleges with the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Icats
Reviews.Content: We visited LA from Oct. 27 to Oct. 30th for Halloween Haunt Night, a USC game and to visit friends. From the moment we checked in at 11:30 at night, the superb staff made us feel welcome, the bar was actually open, and the room was amazing. We got a corner room with a 2 walls of windows (thanks to being Starwood Owners I'm sure!). Great bed, while the bathroom is small, it's fully functionable, and we had a great view of LA. Valet service rocks, as they run to your car and are so nice and helpful. Location was perfect! We took an hour walk to Warner Brothers for a VIP tour (very fun experience) on a beautiful October day, enjoyed a great choice of restaurants on the walk there (recommend Paty's at Toluca Lakes) and walked through lovely residential areas. Took the free shuttle up the hill to CityWalk, did Universal's Halloween Haunt Night (get the Front of the Line pass), and walked back to hotel late at night. Did a USC game, while only 15 miles away, it did take an hour to get there, so have patience! On last day of trip, took a 20 minute drive (through West Hollywood) and went to eat brunch at the Marmalade Cafe at the Grove (outdoor shopping center and farmer's market) where they film Extra everyday. They were preparing for Halloween and Christmas in the same day. Very fun. Overall, great experience. We will return in a heartbeat next year. Great customer service, great room, and with so many fun activities/places to see surrounding the hotel, it's a win-win for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but fairly pricey..”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuy419
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. The whole premise of it was LOCATION, LOCATION, and LOCATION! It provided a courtesy shuttle to the park which proved to be beneficial. I was a tad bit disappointed in the room itself though. It was very clean and neat, but was somewhat small and the view was nothing special considering what I paid. ($300) However, that said I do not believe you pay for "pampering" at this hotel as it is a "destination" type property. Hence paying for location and its proximity to Universal Studios. They did have a mandatory 32$ valet fee/parking fee I believe. I would stay here again without a doubt; however, just because of my curiosity I would most likely try another hotel in the area before I went back here. Overall, stay was pleasant and hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting NBC Universal”
Reviews.Author: 81FrequentT81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night before meetings at NBC Universal. Hotel is just outside Universal. Hotel is a little on the older side, though still quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Universally superb!”
Reviews.Author: Balad
Reviews.Content: Steps from Universal Citywalk and the similarly named adjacent theme park, the Sheraton Universal is arguably the most convenient hotel in the San Fernando Valley.  A subway station for the Metro Red Line which is a 10-minute walk down the hill to Cahuenga, grants quick access the Hollywood attractions and downtown sports venues.  If you care to park on the freeway with 10,000 of your closest friends, the 101, the 134 and the 170 are close by. Universal Citywalk has some great family-friendly restaurants like Wolfgang Puck, Tony Roma's and the Hard Rock Cafe.  And, you can catch Jay Leno filming the "J-Walking" segment of the Tonight Show  right around dinnertime here.     From the exquisitely polished brass handrails on the exterior walkway to the Zen-inspired front lobby, the hotel welcomes the weary traveler with a aura of sophistication and serenity.  I have only been to a handful of other Sheraton properties but this is the nicest by far.   The people who work here rock!  Every staff member we encountered was completely capable and Sam, one of the managers, truly went above and beyond with regard to getting us an extra room for a co-worker at the last minute so we could all be at the same property. I had a very nice room with a view of the Cahuenga Pass. The room was cleaned well with the somewhat troubling exception of pubes in the bathtub.  The Club Lounge was stocked with an ample supply of snacks and beverages and the host and hostess ensured the food items were well presented.   Sadly, this is my last stay as a Platinum member before losing status with Starwood next year.  "Thank you" Sheraton Universal made it great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well located hotel with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MBA31
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7th to 11th November 2011. Excellently located hotel within short walking distance of Universal studios and Universal city. Rooms newly refurbished to a very good standard. The staff are superb, all very helpful and the concierge staff in particular are extremely helpful and knowledgable, providing maps and advice to ensure you make the most of your stay. Highly recommended hotel , would definitely stay there again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: breezy25
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed three nights in October and had a great experience. All staff were so friendly, however the lady at concierge was simply brilliant and helped us plan to use our time to the maximum. She planned a whole day for us when we told her what we would like to see, provided maps and a lot of brilliant information and local knowledge. Our room was very comfortable, the bathroom is small but we were not there to spent time in it ! Location across from Universal Studios was great. We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially for the location but it did have some downs.”
Reviews.Author: vamartinez05
Reviews.Content: We traveled to universal studios and decided since we have a baby it would be great to walk to a close hotel and we chose the Sherwton Universal. The location is excellent and only about a 5 minute walk to Universal Studios. We had 6 adults staying with us and my baby and we were put into an executive suite which I was told it had one bedroom and a queen size bed in the living room area and a couch that would fold out, and about 600 sq ft of space with balcony When I heard this it was perfect especially for the price I was quoted. I walked n and was very pleased with the room only to find out though that there was no bedroom for me and my husbands privacy and the couch did not fold out. I thought where would we put all these people?! Went downstairs thinking they gave me the wrong room but no they said that's only the presidential suite. So I thought why would I make up what the room is the lady told me over the phone. Of course I was upset the only thing they did was offer me one cot free of charge which I accepted but the other adult slept on the couch. Over all the hotel is nice inside and clean, staff is nice. But with then knowing I had 6 adults they should have told me to either get two rooms or upgrade. I asked how much for the presidential suite they never provided me a price and I didn't get the other cot until 4 hours later I had to go back downstairs and ask for it. I would stay here again but make sure the room u get is the correct one just verify it with the rep. My overall experience here was good despite all the adults in a smaller room. We stayed on the 11th floor in room 1109. :) have a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Loll73
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here in the middle of October , rooms a good size (no mininbar) and bathroom very small and dated .Combined shower/bath and old fixtures.The hotel in general just feels tired and old (even though its supposedly been renovated) .The hotel serves a purpose and that is its close proximity to Universal Studios.You can walk there in ten minutes and get to the city walk where you are spoilt for choice on food/drink options . Also the concierge gets very busy and you can wait a while to be seen - also didn't find the concierge very helpful . Would I stay here again ? only if I wasn't paying

Reviews.Title: “Really good customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mrlasvegass
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in September 2011 for a week after leaving the Andaz hotel in West Hollywood due to very poor customer service. Our Tour Operator Virgin booked us in to this hotel and I was initially unconvinced with their choice. However I was very wrong, on our arrival in the late evening by taxicab we were met by two reception manager’s one male and female in what appeared to be very clean and modern hotel. They were very supportive of our previous problems at the Andaz, we paid for the buffet breakfast, we were put on the Sheraton 'Club Level' floor and given vouchers for free drinks on the club level floor as complimentary. The room was very clean and modern with two double beds, free internet, I pod docking station and complimentary starbucks coffee. We also had great views of the city, however there is no mini bar or fridge in the rooms. At the rear of the lobby there are several computers that give you free internet, there is a small store selling basics a very modern bar and a good size 24hour fitness centre on the basement level, which was always empty when we used it, and above all the staff were very friendly and approachable. The Restaurant serving breakfast, and dinner was very clean; we used the breakfast buffet for our six night stay. The choice was really good and varied which included scrambled, boiled and egg omelettes, bacon, sausage, hash browns, hot and cold cereals with bread and muffins, fruits, yogurts and a choice of pastries. Now the fun stuff!! Universal Studios and City Walk is literally on the door step, there is a free shuttle from the hotel that takes you to Universal studios, but you can walk it around five minutes. Universal City Station is a seven minute walk from the Hotel, which is on the red line that takes you directly to Hollywood/Highland (Hollywood Boulevard/Walk of Fame area) one stop in less than ten minutes. It costs $1.50 each way but a day pass was $5 which you can use on the buses and trains. We felt safe on the train when we travelled and that was at all times of the day. The last train being around 1.00am. As I said previously we stayed at this hotel for six nights, the staff were very pleasant, rooms clean and we used the public transport system to get around LA, this included getting public transport to see the dodgers play the Arizona diamondbacks. We would certainly go back to this hotel again if we go back to LA again especially when all you want is a comfy clean bed and room after an eleven hour flight from the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: CbnCampy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 2 of our young children stayed here for a weeeknd to attend my husbands grandmother funeral serivce. The weekend turned into a horrible disaster but the staff at the Sheraton could not have been more accomodating or pleasant. We were to stay for 2 nights, 3 days but only ending up staying for 1 night because my husband got a horrible gall bladder infection and we had to fly him home for surgery. On Saturday at 2am , not knowing what was wrong withmy husband, we needed our car from valet ASAP and without hesitation, valet had it pulled up and we were on our way to the hospital. When we discovered we had to head home early after a long day at the hospital we were passed the checkout time, I told the front desk of our weeeknd not expecting him to cut us any slack, and quite honestly I wasn't asking I just needed to get home and he very gracioulsy didn't charge us for the extra night and wished us a speedy recovery. He offered his condolences and hoped we all got back safely. It was just those words I needed to get me through. A total stranger taking the extra time to say a few words of encourgement meant a whole lot after the ordeal we had been in. Aside from that, the room was super comfortable, roomy and valet was excellent. The business center was great and convienent, especially since I needed to use it to get an emergencey flight home for my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: TexasTripper_7
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for the location and comfort and were very pleased with the cleanliness of the room and the accomodating hotel staff. We called the front desk on several occasions during our four night stay and our concerns were addressed immediately (extra towels, room refrigerator, noisy neighbors). Loved the Starbucks coffee in the rooms. Two drawbacks - the walls are so thin you can hear the guests next to you talking so when they started yelling at 2am, we woke up and called security. This happened 2 nights in a row. Also, clean your windows Sheraton!!! We pulled back the drapes to look at the amazing views and could hardly see it due to dirty windows that looked like muddy water had been thrown on them. Otherwise, got a good rate when bundled with a car rental so definately worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here ALL THE TIME- Great Location IN LA”
Reviews.Author: Sparky8188
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Universal is in a great location to get to lots of different things easily in LA. We stay here all the time and we are treated like family by all the staff. The hotel does get very busy on the weekends with events and guests so beware of longer elevator waits but other than that the hotel has everything you need. The rooms are very quiet. The club level lounge is amazing! The pool and gym are nice. You are within walking distance to all the City Walk restaurants and to Universal Studios which is very nice! You are minutes away from Ventura Avenue and all the shops and restaurants that it offers. I suggest flying into Burbank and staying at this hotel! You won't be disappointed and it's hassle free!

Reviews.Title: “This place is everything you could ask for in a top notch hotel.”
Reviews.Author: reddoor14
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay while visiting universal studios. It felt secluded although close to the theme park and gave us a chance to get away from the crowds to a high class place. I would stay there again! The staff made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Serves the purpose”
Reviews.Author: bayareaxplant
Reviews.Content: Fluffy bed- check. Fluffy towels- check. Complimentary coffee and tea- check. Room service- check. Prices are rather steep (conference-specific rate $169/night), but you are near Universal Studios. Fourteen percent occupancy tax and Internet is $10/day of access in your room, just so you know. Food prices also high-- expect to drop at least $16 on breakfast alone. Room service for breakfast- very nice with a congenial waiter. Lobby-- a bit smaller than most business hotels (more like a living room), but that meant the walk to the elevator was really short. Liked the lounge chairs. Toilet was a little wonky-- often the lever didn't return back to its original position on its own after flushing and had to be pushed back into place. The restrooms in the lobby area had better operating toilets. TV account statement channel wasn't working. I stayed for 4 nights. First night had a loud couple getting it on next door. The next 3 nights were fine. Location was really close to the CityWalk, where decent restaurants could be found. You could probably get more bang for your buck in, say, Holiday Inn Express, where Internet and breakfast are included in a lower price, but if you have no car and rely on conference shuttles to take you to places, this is a really good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, some outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Sjc462
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived we received a warm welcome from the valet parking which was a great start to our LA stay. The room, on the SPG level was great, with good views, however, it would have been nice to have had a fridge of some sort. This hotel felt safe and was perfectly located for Universal Studios and the City Walk. There is a complimentary shuttle to the Studios but it is a 5 minute walk, if that. Prior to coming to this hotel I had phoned, from the UK to get a treat arranged but was bitterly disappointed when we got to the room that this had not been arranged, and was even more dismayed that when I went to the gym and spoke to a young lady on reception she appeared disinterested, however on speaking to another receptionist, Cherry I think my faith was restored with a complimentary gift to the room. The SPG lounge is clean & pleasant and you can keep yourself stocked up with bottles of cold water from the fridge. If the sky lounge is not being used for a function I can highly recommend going up there, especially at night where you will get some stunning views. I will certainly chose this hotel if I go to LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the parks”
Reviews.Author: lppenny23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a mini trip to the park. I think it's def overpriced for the quality of the hotel. The people there were great and the drinks at the hotel bar were very cheap at happy hour! The hotel is very close to the park so that's nice. The bed was not so comfy and the room needed a little updating. We called at night for a robe and slippers and they brought it right up. Good hotel.. Yet overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to visit Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: BKBLUELOGIC
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to visit Universal Studios then this hotel is just right for you. It is walking distance from Universal Studios - LA and City walk. There is a free shuttle service through out the day if you don't want to walk. Standard rooms are very basic, but the bed was comfortable. If you want to spend much time in your hotel room , I advice you to go for an upgrade, as the rooms are small in size. We were one couple so the size of the room was acceptable and we didn't spend anytime in the room except when we wanted to shower or sleep. There is no minibar or fridge for standard room so if you are planning to buy stuff that needs a fridge think twice. We bought chips and biscuits for snacks. The parking is 18 US$ per day but you can go in and out as much as you like. So include that in your budget if you are renting a car. I would advice you to rent a car in LA as the taxis are bit pricey. Hotel lobby is very nice and clean, staff are friendly. The 45 minutes free internet at the lobby for guests are very useful and you can use printers to print boarding passes or tickets for free. We used to check tripadvisor for local attractions nearby and plan our day. There is internet in the room with a fee. Breakfast was around 22 US$ open buffet but limited, however you don't need more than scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries , french toast, fruit salad, hash browns to start your day.
