I suggest you walk to city walk mall for breakfast if you are an early riser since shuttles start at around 9 am. In conclusion, if you are planning a trip to LA and your main goal is to visit Universal studios and spend most of your time there I highly recommend the hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “Crowded and a bit noisy, but clean,fun and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: cynthia555
Reviews.Content: Nothing can beat this location if one is headed to Universal Studios and the whole tourist thing in LA. For such a large hotel the employees and services were pretty darn good. Room service was efficent n well priced. Kids and teenage sport teams abounded, yet finding a semi-quiet adult bar area was simple. Lots of dining options,easy park access, and little shops make this Shearaton a nice option, especially if you have teens who want to go back n forth. It's also nice to be able to eat or drink non-park(rip off)items in the room or hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel for "name your own price"”
Reviews.Author: truxr4girlz
Reviews.Content: I was able to get this hotel for $89 a night on priceline, but I would never pay more then that. Our room was VERY small, one of the tiniest bathrooms ever and I travel often. Self Parking is $18 a night which is average for this area. The concierge was super hard to understand with her hard accent and wouldnt stop pushing us to get a town car instead of a cab (pretty annoying, she waisted 20 minutes of our time by refusing to get the cab and pushing the town car!!) We ordered room service which was 15 minutes late, and we were in a hurry that morning (the whole reason we ordered room service) . Very overpriced.. Which I know room service is pricey, but when ordering a bagel I expected better quality, maybe costco sized bagel for $6. Not a tiny stail thomas bagel.. not even garnish on the plate, kind of shocking. And a side of hashbrowns for $6 that was smaller then the palm of my hand.. Also, it says on their website rooms have refridgerators, They do NOT! we didnt use the pool or hot tub, but the main reason we didnt is because the hot tub looked somewhat green from our room view. We also had a view of Vivid Entertainment studios (porn production company) LOL.. I must mention the positive points of our stay also! It was the PERFECT location for the reason we came to the area. If you are going to attend tapings to any tv shows its very close to all of the studios, LOVE that! I wish I knew the name of the guy sho checked us in . He was SO friendly and made us feel very welcomed and genuinly seemed to care about our stay. If concierge gets paid more he should be promoted! Also loved the walking distance to universal city. Although we didnt go to the theme park, the city walk is fantastic and I highly reccomend it. Very affordable restaurants there, and many of them! We plan to come to the area several times a year because we loved the experience of TV show tapings and still have so many things we want to do. Would only stay at the Sheraton again if there is an AMAZING deal, but will never order room service again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Past_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I had a quick stay at this hotel. Upon arriving, I was very impressed with the lobby. It was very modern and reminded me of a W hotel. The front desk men were very nice, helpful and efficient. I was upgraded to a corner room, which I assume had a little bit more space. The beds were the normal Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds and very comfortable. There was a small flat screen tv in the room. The bathroom was smaller than some, but bigger than other hotels I've stayed in. It wasn't terrible by any means. The only "awkward" part was that the toilet was really close to the bathroom door. You couldn't open the door if someone was sitting down. I could hear the sounds of other guests through the walls at times, but I think that is somewhat normal when you're in a hotel. Overall, the room was clean and perfectly fine for my trip. I would stay here again. I was by myself this trip, but even if I were travelling with others, there was plenty of room in the room itself and several mirrors throughout the room so that you could continue getting ready while someone else is in the bathroom. The only odd thing was that when I woke up in the middle of the night, I didn't see an alarm clock, which is very odd for any hotel room. Upon waking up in the morning and looking around, there was an alarm clock, it just wasn't plugged in and I hadn't realized that the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hollie_s8
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 2 sisters, one of which was with her husband and young family. The hotel provided everything we needed for our short stay there, a pool for the kids, a short walk to the Universal City Walk and nightlife for us - Hotel had comfortable rooms, perfect location, and an amazing breakfast. Staff were very friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If you are visiting Universal Studios it is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for universal”
Reviews.Author: claremac1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the day that we visited universal studios. Its a great location for this and there is a shuttle bus that takes you to and from the studios every 10-15 mins, only takes a couple of mins once your on. The hotel itself is very nice. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The front desk staff were really helpful they provided us with lots of information regarding shopping and eating out which we had not received at our first hotel, I wish we had! If you are going to universal then I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: CopenhagenMax
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and it was our first time to Sheraton in years since we stopped staying at Sheraton some years ago since we thought they were all old and needed refurbishment. Now this hotel has been renovatet and we found out many of the Sheratons are going through renovation. The room was very nice and spacious and since I love Starbucks coffee I was happy to see the room was equipped with a coffee maker and Starbucks coffee :-) There is a nice pool area, not big but not overcrowded so after the gym and a shower it was great relaxing there. Location is good eventhough you do not want to go to Universal Studios etc. (which we did not) The staff was very friendly in all areas and we did not experience any problems at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MAK101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for five days during a conference. We received an excellent event rate. The room wasn't huge but it was nicely appointed with dark wood furniture, flat screen TV, and a pull-out couch. It didn't appear old or in need of updating. I obtained a "Lanai Room" which overlooked the pool with a balcony -- I was told by other conference attendees that their regular rooms weren't as nice as ours. Maid service was thorough and efficient. The restaurant, bar, and gift shop were nice but over-priced. There are your typical conference rooms as well as a small bank of computers. There's a small bar by the pool. The customer service at this hotel was truly first-class; I didn't encounter anyone who wasn't exceptionally friendly, helpful and highly professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, showing some wear”
Reviews.Author: APDJOHN
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this property. The lobby was nice, the staff were great and so friendly. The bathroom would be my only complaint as it was showing wear and needed to be fixed. The paint was peeling and just generally worn out. Other than that, you cannot beat the location if you are going to Universal. Again, the staff made the trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: emquad46
Reviews.Content: Small rooms with even smaller bathrooms. We had an event rate of $159 per night plus $22 to park our car, 12 cent State Tourism Assessment, 14% Occupancy Room Tax and $23 for parking..total $206.77!!!!! Hotel is dated and needs major refreshment, although the furniture in the room appeared to be relatively new. Restaurant is very good for breakfast and lunch. Event space for the wedding we attended was spectacular..located on the top floor with floor to ceiling windows that gave 270 degrees of view. Food was very good at the wedding.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location...”
Reviews.Author: ielkin
Reviews.Content: Easy access to major road 101/170, walk to subway station AND to the Studios! Comfortable room and bed, all amenities as expected. Free internet stations, huge parking garage. Great service, including concierge. "Minuses": long elevators waiting time, especially in "rush hrs"; morning "starbucks" in the lobby bar is quite far from the real brand flavor. Otherwise its all good.

Reviews.Title: “I wrote the review 2 mo ago that was titled "stay at the Hilton"”
Reviews.Author: Motnzil
Reviews.Content: 2 mo ago we had an unfortunate experience. My husband and I decided to give it another chance and boy did the Sheraton redeem themselves!! Extremely clean room, nice and quiet, everything in perfect working order, staff was professional, friendly, and extremely helpful, club lounge was clean and fresh, our overall stay was a 10 out of 10! Everyone deserves a 2nd chance and I'm glad we stayed there again, so happy with the hotel we will be coming back in October with our children to attend Universal Studios again!!! Thank you Sheraton for going above and beyond, see you next month!!!

Reviews.Title: “HOT in CALIFORNIA..........................”
Reviews.Author: Louise0518
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four day visit to California and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. A special thanks to Fernando, the conceirge, who helped us with all our questions and booked our tickets for the new, Cirque del Soliel, IRIS. He even took the time to show us the quick way from the hotel to the subway in order to get to Hollywood and Vine to the Kodak Theatre where the show was being held. It was only $3.00 round trip. The room at the Sheraton was clean and the beds were VERY comfortable. And, yes, this is the hotel where ELLEN has her guests stay during her shows. A very enjoyable stay, but way too short. We will certainly keep this hotel in mind if we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “WE will never stay in a sheraton again--see below--”
Reviews.Author: footballmom50
Reviews.Content: we booked 3 nights online, I have 2 adult children , they gave us a room with 2 dbl beds ;my son the football star had to sleep on floor first night,tiny ,dinky rooms , veiw was of back of hotel### ---that not all---during first night & every night we were there the fire alarm went off announcing ---PLEASE EVACUATE-- yea--after the first night they changed our room & gave us comp breakfast-- well this alarm went off every night we stayed there--- moma here was soooo pissed by chekout , wen I complained at fr. desk ,I said I booked this hotel to get some sleep ----- they told me they could not refund my $ cause I booked online--I said -U dont have to pay the online agency--I got refunded but if my wheel didnt SKWEAKK- I would not have gotten any -- GREASE----have a fab day---

Reviews.Title: “brillant location for LA would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: streakySWales
Reviews.Content: Travelled with Virgin, Arrived at the Sheraton and found it be a modern look hotel. On our arrival was given a room that was not ready and as an apology without any hestiation they offered free internet access for the holiday. With a teenage daughter who wanted to keep in touch with friends on social network sites that was very usefull. We were given room 818 which had a lovely view of the hills, The breakfast was buffet but more than enough for what was needed. There didn't seem to be many breakfast diners close by which you find in other parts of the States. Location wise could walk to Universal studios without any hassle. The hotel is located on the side of the freeway with ease to travel towards the Pacific Coast but noise from the traffic which in LA is considerable is not a problem. The Hotel has well equipped gym and light and airy bar. All the staff were friendly and would recommend this hotel to others. Parking on site was $18 a day but that in that part of LA was not extortationate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: denjolu
Reviews.Content: Clean, close to attractions, nice view. The lobby was beautiful and the rooms were nice and clean. The beds were comfortable. Universal Studios and Citywalk within walking distance. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: peter_vpnet
Reviews.Content: The staff showed that they were trained properly and provided me with excellent service. I was even impressed with the valet service which normally is the downfall of most properties. It was the first time that a valet cleaned my windshield when they noticed it was dirty. Sometimes the smallest details means the most. The only negative was the long wait for the elevators in the morning and the small sink in the guest room. Other than that, my stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMB54_11
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Sheraton Universal for the 3rd time. As always my stay was excellent. The hotel is easy to get to as it is near Highway 101. Check in was a breeze. The bed in the room was nice and comfortable. The TV was a nice size. Bathroom was clean and so was the whole room. Had a nice room with a view of the pool and the houses on the hill. I enjoyed the pool a couple of times. Plenty of places to sit and lots of towels available. Had breakfast a couple of mornings. The buffet was very good. There was a variety of foods to choose from. Billy the waiter is outstanding at his job. He is friendly and attentive. Used the shuttle to get to Universal Studios. It is also a short walk to get from the hotel to the park. Dai the concierge is exceptional at his job. Dai was very helpful to me. I always saw him busy with guests when I was in the lobby. I will stay at the Sheraton Universal when I'm in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: Margaret F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property in the past and all of my time there including this month, was just great. Staff was incredible from the housekeeping to the front desk to the restaurant and the bar area. Weather was great in LA and I would never ever consider staying anywhere else. Sheraton in Universal City is the place to be. I was glad to get back home but when I climbed into my bed, I couldn't help but wish I was still in the large king comfy bed at the Sheraton :) Go there and stay - you will not regret it. Margaret

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Scorp1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Universal Sheraton with my partner. The room had a king size bed, small loveseat, coffee table and desk. Nice size bathroom, closet and balcony overlooking the pool. The room was clean and the hallways were quiet. The hotel has a spacious well-kept lobby and very friendly staff. And it's pet friendly. I would definitely stay here again when I get back to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location. Website does not do it justice. Staff brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: leeclump5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Wanted to be close to universal studios...couldn't be closer, could see studios and filming locations right from our bedroom window. Free shuttle takes you to and from universal all day and up until 9.30pm. After this time you can walk back, takles about ten minutes and is downhill. Staff superb. Nothing too much trouble. One of our group was poorly with ear infection, staff were great at organising taxi to a drs surgery etc. Very helpful! Breakfast was great. Most of us ordered off the menu, but buffet also good. Upgraded to front of line pass for universal studios. Well worth it, queued for 30seconds to 1 min for the rides. Whereas other queues approximately 50-70minutes long!! We organised a private tour of the sights, for family of 5 this was cheaper than using open top tour bus...which in the heat would have been awful! Would definitely stay here again if we were going back to universal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for after a long day at Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: 100countries_or_bust
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after having spent the entire day (opening to closing!) at Universal Studios. Lovely dip in the large pool but there were no clean pool towels because it was late. The rooms were a bit run down although the bathoom was in good shape. Great breakfast in the lounge (we had access because of our Starwoods status and not the room in which we staying). Biggest benefit - learned that we could leave our car in valet parking until midnight the night we checked out for no additional cost. We left the car, caught the "free" Hop On Hop Off shuttle to downtown Hollywood and didn't end up having to find parking or drive in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: strawmato
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short walk away from the Univeral city walk. There are buses to downtown LA. Really enjoyed my stay and Universal Studies being 5 minutes away meant that I could stay n the park all day and not worry about shuttle buses. My only minor problem was that my room was difficult to find as it was at the rear of the building. Once I knew where I was going it wasn't a problem. Lots of conferences going on at hte hotel which meant the bar/restaurant was always busy. Easier to eat out on the city walk.

Reviews.Title: “I have spent over 20 nights in this hotel and it is nice.”
Reviews.Author: Exploremt
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel for business a couple times a year. It has a stylish lobby and nice views. I have no complaints about the staff they all seem pleasant. I do not reccommend eating at the resturant or drinking at their bar as their pricing is outrageous. There are plenty of good resturants within a 10 minute drive and if you are on foot, simply walk up to the carnival atmosphere of the Universal City Walk, which while somewhat overstimulating and full of tourists has some decent resturants and bars that are, if you can believe it, cheaper than at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are going to Universal”
Reviews.Author: SimmoHanoi
Reviews.Content: This is a good five star hotel very handy to Universal Studios. Rooms are decent. They charged us an extra 50% for late check out which borders on being fair. They run a shuttle bus to Universal which stops you having to pay for parking

Reviews.Title: “Nicer of the Universal area options - Not ideal for business”
Reviews.Author: adrienne_dewey
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed on a Sunday/Monday night business trip to the Burbank area. This hotel is nice on the inside - the lobby and the rooms are updated and have a nice "old hollywood" feel to them. I would say though that the service stinks for a business traveler and they clearly are overwhelmed with irritating tourists. The lobby is packed with kids (as is the pool) - wild and not very well attended. On Sunday nights they have multiple weddings on the top floor, making the entire place buzz. The top floor are apparently very loud to sleep in until 1AM when the weddings end. When I first arrived, even though I am a preferred guest, I was given a room on the bottom floor, overlooking an unlit patio that had a sliding glass door that was broken and would not lock. I called the front desk to get a new room and I was really hassled by the front desk. Although they eventually helped me, I felt like the hotel staff was overwhelmed and unable to really accommodate the level of visitors they have - especially for those of us wanting hassle free business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Add a jungle gym to the Club Level”
Reviews.Author: paul h
Reviews.Content: I am a SPG member and this is my second time coming to this hotel. Last year tthe Sheraton had complimentary beer and wine. Not this year. I must say too many children running wild with no supervision. No wonder kids get abducted, anyways - The club level is a disaster - No where to sit, dirty little hands touching everything, limited selection and the wonderful laughter of the precious children. The morning was worse. I get free nights so I shouldn't complain, but what the heck. I will continue to use my points, but i will not splurge on the Club Level. The Sheraton must be really discounting these rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: coastskigirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as we were planning on visiting Universal Studios. Was so close we were able to walk or catch the shuttle bus that left at regular intervals. The young guy we got for our check in was really friendly and helpful and as our flight was leaving late happily gave us a late check out. Probably the only annoying thing is no free wi-fi in rooms and the cost of car parking but overall we where happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Tina K
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Sheraton Universal Hotel. We loved every second of it. The entire staff was excellent and really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The maid said hello to us every morning and made small conversations. The concierge was great. He worked efficiently, but also provided each guest with the attention that they deserved. The people at the front desk were super friendly and helpful upon our arrival. The waiter during happy hour kept our snacks full and our drinks replenished. Our room was very comfortable and had everything that I would expect in a hotel room. Yeah, the bathroom was a little small, but I'd rather have space in the room than have the bathroom take up space. The view was also wonderful. We were on the 16th floor, so we got a nice view of the pool and of the surrounding scenery. I'm not sure what they do, but when you enter the lobby, it smells amazing. I loved breathing in when I walked in each time, as weird as that may sound. The location of the hotel was the best part. It is so close to Universal Studios and they offer a discount of 2 days for the price of 1. We took advantage of buying the tickets from the concierge, but didn't end up going the second day because we saw everything at the park (except for the Shrek 4D--we weren't interested in that) in just 8 hours. I suppose we could have gone back and done some things twice, but 8 hours was enough when you're in the sun and crowds, and we had other things we wanted to do while on vacation. We didn't take the free shuttle from the hotel because we were so close that we just walked. (Avoid doing this if you do not do well with hills.) This brought us to many entertainment options from movie theaters, a bowling alley, restaurants, shops, bars, etc. Anyone can find something to do and something they will like to eat at the City Walk area. We were also a super close drive to NBC Studios and Warner Bros. Studios. We went and saw the Tonight Show with Jay Leno and took a Warner Bros Studio Tour while we were there. Both were great experiences and extremely close to the hotel. The only complaint that we had was that the elevators were very slow. They were often over crowded because people didn't want to wait anymore. I think it was pretty normal to wait at least 5 minutes for an elevator. Being on the 16th floor, I wasn't about to take the stairs. The ride up was very uncomfortable when people overstuffed themselves into the small space. In the hotel's defense, there was some pageant going on during our stay as well as the Teen Choice Awards, so perhaps they were busier than normal and their elevators don't normally experience these types of delays? The parking also was a bit pricey. I mean come on, $18 a day for a piece of concrete? That was a little bit annoying, but I guess that's life. All in all, we had a great time at the Sheraton and would definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mottrex
Reviews.Content: Had a two week vacation here with my two teenage children and the hotel was lovely.. Set 5 mins from Universal Studios over looking the Valley it had incredible views of the Mountains and looked great lit up at night. Our room overlooked the pool which was very nice clean and decked with Huge palm trees. The Hotel lobby was very Art Deco in colours and style and the staff were amazingly helpful when our key was lost and a new one was generated whilst I waited. The car park price was a bit expensive $14 I think but the car was safe and secure,we did get a small concession as we stayed their for 14 nights. The room we stayed in had two large twin beds and a large tv and was very spacious and met our needs..

Reviews.Title: “"Best Hotel of the Road trip"”
Reviews.Author: lumeljay1
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived we had nothing but wonderful feelings about this hotel. Though we self parked the valet attendants were friendly and eager to help. Front desk staff were great and our room on the 8th floor gave us a great view of the pool area. Though we didn't use the restaurant we did use Starbucks for breakfast which was just fine with us. There was a pool party on when we arrived so we headed down for music and food reasonably priced. The shuttle service was excellent to Universal and Citywalk provided lots of restaurant choices. The rooms were the cleanest I have ever seen and the decor modern and attractive. Best stay in a two week roadtrip. Loved the shampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly People Really Make a Difference”
Reviews.Author: RaceGirl_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we went to Universal Studios for the day. From the moment we drove on to the property the staff was welcoming and friendly. We had a great stay here because the staff made it memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: brooksterann
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights @ the Sheraton Universal. We got a great rate through a "name your own price" website (midweek stay probably helped) and we were not disappointed. The front desk employee was polite and he gave us our bedding choice "even though we booked through a third party"... The room was a bit small but very quiet, the beds were comfortable, linens and pillows were nice, and room & bathroom were very clean. No fridge, but our cooler sufficed. Free shuttle to Universal runs every 20 min (or less) and drops you off at the center of City Walk (very close to park entrance). We did not eat at the hotel, but we did use the fitness center and although small, the equipment & facilities were clean and very nice. Our room was on the 8th floor of the tower and had a pretty pool & hillside view. My only issues were that they charge extra for everything (parking, internet etc) and that they did not make up our room the first day, but they brought us extra towels and coffee very quickly when we requested them. Overall it was a great stay and very convenient for visiting Universal and the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest hotel employees.”
Reviews.Author: pres2n
Reviews.Content: The entire staff here is courteous, kind and friendly. Rooms were fine, had to ask for resupply for toiletries, but it was taken care of immediately. Rooms along the freeway are a bit noisy. Food was surprisingly good in downstairs hotel restaurant. Location is great to Universal Studios; shuttle bus drops guests of at Sheraton first!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed - expected more from Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Michal32
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights there. I rated this hotel with just 3/5 stars as I think you have a right to expect more from this chain. The most annoying was problems with internet – any browser couldn’t open the login site, neither from laptop nor smartphone. I finally called quest service, they transfer me to external tech-support company and I spent like 20 minutes with very nice guy who helped me login into internet.. But it shouldn’t be like that. Then breakfast – you pay like 20USD for buffet but the choice was very limited. So for me – another “-”. Location – if you are going to visit Universal City or Hollywood – very good choice (one stop by metro from Hollywood blvd. – Kodak Theatre). If Santa Monica or downtown – take another one. Be aware – 100% no smoking hotel. There was also strike of some employees during my stay - just in front of the hotel – bit loud … but ok, it happens - appreciated that the hotel manager addressed quests with letter explaining situation and apologies. So generally – hotel ok, but from Sheraton you expect more…

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a star among local hotels but not anymore”
Reviews.Author: globbiztravel
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Universal Sheraton for the past 12 years. I have experienced a wide range of service and issues during all 4 ownership changes and management at the hotel. Prior to the renovation was probably the best time period for this hotel. Management was great at that time. Presently over the past 12 month period I have stayed at the hotel about 6-8 different times. Current management is not what I would consider to be responsive or care about their customers. They offer comment cards but NEVER respond to issues. This is not a hotel for business travelers as the hotel does not cater to them. If you are on vacation then you are the perfect victim to the hotel as there is no timliness in their vocabulary. I met with the operations manager On one of my past trips and he assured me everything would be corrected. That was a lie. The hotel has no quality control - some examples arriving in the room and TV doesn't work or no shower curtain in bathroom or telephone never charged and not operating or light bulbs burned out and non operating. This is hotel management 101 and this hotel doesn't care. Other negatives include untimely delivery of room service breakfast when ordered the night before, not reading breakfast card to not include certain items because they cause extreme allergy and could cause medical emergency, high speed wireless is a joke, some rooms have air conditioning while others don't, gift shop hours vary depending on when they decide they want to close despite hours posted in hotel guide. Forget about enjoying the view frOm your room as it would appear windows have never been washed on the outside - only when it rains. The value charged for nightly accommodations increases during summer months when there are more tourists. The prices do not meet the value at this hotel. It is sad that a hotel within the SPG family lacks proper management, upkeep of technology, quality control and time management so that all guests are treated fairly and their needs are met. I guess long time loyalty to a hotel doesn't matter anymore.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SantaBarbaraSusieQ
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with our daughter and her 4 year old triplet sons. We had adjoining rooms that were beautiful and comfortable, and everyone bent over backwards to make our stay a great one.

Reviews.Title: “I'm trying to reach a CEO or manager of Sheraton Universal Hotel Please!”
Reviews.Author: rob_44_11
Reviews.Content: July 16, 2011 through July 27, 2011: 11 day stay with the Sheraton Universal Hotel in Los Angeles, CA. Problem #1: Prior to our trip, I made several phone calls to this hotel to inquire about it's location and services in relation to our planned activities. I was told that this hotel was in walking distance and also had a shuttle available to where my son's daily workshop was held (Oakwood Complex--NYFA). This information was completely inaccurate. Upon arrival, I had to figure out transporation which was an added expense and an enormous concern/hassle beings the transporation was for a minor. We had to take cabs daily back and forth to his location which often times the location within the complex would change making it tricky for my son to accurately give the information to the cab service. One evening he had to wait 55 minutes for a pickup and it was 10:00 p.m. and remember he is a minor. Next HUGE problem, on the first day that we needed the cab service, the Sheraton had a cab pull up to their lobby for us. The cab was one which had a permit for the Sheraton location. We got into the cab and as the cab pulled around the fountain in the Sheraton drive, another cab driver stopped our driver and they started fighting, cursing and threatening to kill each other. This didn't stop. I tried to open the cab door on my side but the handle was broken. Then our cab driver screamed at us to get out and go with the other mother [...] cab driver. We jumped out of the cab and turned around to look at the valet employees of the Sheraton. They just shrugged. They did not help us out and we were in their driveway. I inquired prior to our trip about car rental services. I could have gotten a car prior to our trip for $450 for the week. During my several phone conversations with the Sheraton Hotel, the hotel information employee insisted that we wouldn't need a rental car to get my son to and from his daily workshop, I had given him the address and he insisted that he knew the location well. So, I did not arrange a rental car prior to our trip. Then, once we were at the hotel and discovered that a car would be needed, the hotel said we could get one for $55 a day. This was incorrect because all the rental company had available at that point was for $99 a day or a weekly charge of over $800. I did check online as well and the same held true. I also made several phone calls on my own and was given similar expensive quotes. This clearly was not in my budget. So, we were stuck with a cab and only rented a car for one day of travel. Problem #2: Our first night we arrived approximately at 10:00 p.m. The room we were given we were told was on the 2nd floor. We stopped to ask FOUR employees for assistance in finding our room. None of them knew how to get there!!!!! Our 2nd floor room when finally found was downstairs to what appeared to be a basement level. Very confusing!!! Since it's clearly after 10:30 p.m. now, we are tired and frustrated by the lack of knowledge by employees. The room was creepy because the lights kept flickering, The worst part of our first night was at 2:30 a.m., the alarm went off and told us to evacuate the building. We hurridly got dressed, went out in the hall, and only saw one other family on our floor. Our two families were not able to locate an exit to lead us directly out of the building. We finally found our way to the inside of the pool. At this point, we found a housekeeping person. We asked what to do and they casually said it was a false alarm and we could go back to the room. At no time, was there an announcement that all was clear for people in the hotel. Problem # 3: On our second day, I requested to be moved to a different room. We moved to the 15th floor. At 1:45 a.m. that night, an alarm went off again to tell us to evacuate the building for an emergency. This alarm went off for 10 or more minutes. We got dressed and headed down the 15 flights of stairs. We finally arrived to the lobby ONLY to have to ask again what to do and then being told that it was again a false alarm. How come the hotel didn't get employees out or use an intercom to rely this information to people????? Problem # 4: I got stuck in the elevator twice and one of the times I had to wait 10 minutes before the elevator started up again. When I used the help button in the elevator, a person came on who kept asking me not to hang up and where was I calling from. Problem #5: We had the world's worst dinner one evening at the hotel and it was too late to order anything else from the hotel at that time. We ordered two dinners of penne pasta with broc. We could squeeze the water out of the bowl--so soggy and yucky neither one of us could eat it. It was an expensive meal. Bright side: Cesar from the restaurant was the most friendly employee of this Sheraton. When he asked how our dinner was, I shared wtih him that it was not something we could eat. He immediately gave us a coupon to order again at another time. Very thoughtful gentlemen who has excellent customer service! He by far was the shining part of this hotel experience! Thank you Cesar! Maybe Cesar should run the entire hotel. Just a suggestion.... Problem #6: There were a few employees of the Sheraton that showed us good customer service--the housekeeping people were very helpful and our room was kept very clean, the people who were outside the lobby at the desk were friendly and helpful, and the people at the front desk were as helpful as well, except for when I shared our hotel dissatisfaction. The information desk employees were always overbooked and often times made guests feel llike an inconveinience although they were informative. Some of the employees in the restaurant (except for Cesar and two male waiters) were often rude and did not go out of their way to help. They also seemed to sneer at us when we would ask a question. My son noticed it on several occasions and he's just a kid. Where's the customer service??? Problem #7: I had shared this experience of our stay on day 7 with an employee at the front desk. I told the front desk that I had prepaid for an 11 day stay at this hotel and was extremely unhappy with the experience. I asked about getting some days comped since we still had four more days left or about getting money taken off our bill. The employee, although very friendly and courteous, said that was not possible. She told me we could have four free breakfasts and free internet for the next four days. I told her that free internet is already available in the lobby so that's not any help and although the breakfast idea was okay, I had already clearly spent a few hundred dollars on meals at the hotel anyway so the breakfast was not much of a break. The employee told me that I couldn't get any type of a refund because I prepaid. I discussed with her that this is inaccurate because I have the statement showing that I could get reinbursed or money taken off since I wasn't asking for a full refund. I asked about visiting with someone who could talk more with me about this situation and no one was available. Our family has stayed in many Sheratons throughout the U.S. and has never been disappointed before. This hotel stay was a nightmare!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I am desperately trying to reach someone who can help me with this situation and each time I've called the Sheraton, I only get the front desk who is unable to answer my questions or send me to someone who can. I spent $2,613.00 for the hotel room alone, over $650 on services offered through the hotel--food, gift shop, room service, and $275 in cab service to and from my son's workshop (as mentioned above the hotel insisted we could walk it-no way it was at Oakwood Complex and this amount of course does not include the rest of our cab fares). I am desperately trying to reach management for this Sheraton and would LOVE to speak with the CEO of this hotel chain. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone for any type of stay--either vacation or business (for business people, most Sheratons offer complimentary Starbucks coffee in the lobbby for a bit in the a.m., not this one--Starbucks coffee only for sale). This stay may affect if our family ever stays at a Sheraton again. The stay was that disappointing and expensive. I knew the cost of our stay would be pricey but did not figure that the services provided would be far from adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great.”
Reviews.Author: sacoxf
Reviews.Content: I feel pretty sure this was not worth the price of Aprox. $200. The room was on the small size. The first room we were given had a gigantic red stain on the carpet, one dirty sock and a body sized grease smudge on the window. The moved us to another room and gave us free parking for the inconvenience. But I think they could have offered more. The restaurant had a very small menu. The rooms around the pool looked nice, but in the tower where we stayed, it was small and cramped with windows that needed a good wash. I was excited to stay in this hotel as it's close to universal and it has a shuttle and looks really nice in the pictures. Everything is much smaller (the room, the pool) in person. I do happen to stay in Starwood hotels frequently. I will not return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: azmommyof2
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14yr, 6yr & I stayed here for a trip to Universal Studios. The hotel room was fine, no complaints. We needed extra towels & they were promptly delivered within minutes of calling front desk. There is a shuttle to Universal Studios but we did not use it as the park is extremely close. If you are not completely out of shape or elderly, the walk should not be a problem for u. It's probably 5 minutes away.... We'll probably not return to Universal Studios again but if we did, we would definitely stay here. Btw, I was lucky enough to get this hotel using Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" feature :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hilton instead!!!”
Reviews.Author: Motnzil
Reviews.Content: 1. The lock on the sliding glass door was broken off and it was about 1/4 of an inch sharp metal. Reported it two days in a row it NEVER got fixed!! I have a picture on my camera to prove it.  2. The metal bar to lock sliding glass door was also broken that when My daughter went to open the door it fell on top of her head. My husband immediately called the front desk.  3. Pillow  cover was stained and also had little spots mold. Reported and was never changed. Also have pictures of that. 4. Two days in a row I asked for a refrigerator and neither time did anybody get back to me to tell me if they did or didn't have one.  5. It's a "universal" hotel, it states there's a nickelodeon channel but you have to pay 2.99 per show. There are no children channels.  6. Saturday night we go to get in our room and they changed the the code to the lock, when we were prepaid for 3 nights. Tired and all, had to walk back to the front desk to get a new key. Just a complete inconvenience for no reason! 6. Bathroom is so incredibly small. So is the room, you can hardly walk.  7. The lobby smells so incredibly strong like air freshener you can smell it from outside and gave me a sinus headache.  8. Twice they  forgot to leave wash cloths. And only left three full size towels. Isn't there an order of how the rooms should be prepped?  9. Beds are so rickety and uncomfortable. After they claim and boast about their Sheraton beds. They are terrible.  10. It was 10:30 at night and so incredibly loud.  11.  There was hair in the shower from a previous guest. Toilet was dirty  The whole room was just not clean at all.  12. After we packed up our room at 8:00pm we called for a cart and 25 minutes later we still had NOT received one so we did not want to wait anymore and had to drag all of our stuff out! The service and hotel was the most disgusting experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RosieMarie95
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel and I have to say I was not left too impressed by the service. From reading the reviews here it appears that if you do not stay at club level you receive no service at all!! The hotel itself is a great location with the shuttle bus running to Universal Stuidos which is a great help. The rooms were clean but small, we had 4 adults in one room and don't be fooled by the advertised room sizes, it was cozy!! When we arrived there were not enough towels in the room for the number of people staying there, when I called reception they said they would send some extra towels... they never arrived. The next morning and another phone call to guest services extra towels arrived. We did order room service the night we arrived as it was late and we were tired, food was lovely but expensive for what we got. The concierge desk were very helpful when we were leaving to drive to Anaheim and provided us with maps and the best routes to take. The location of this hotel is great but I think if you want to make your stay a little more special you may need to book a room at club level. We had to wait a while for the lifts but it wasn't too bad. we self parked and they do allow in and out privilages that you are not charged for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: MichaelCowley
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our time here as it's a great location for the Universal Studios visit. Had an executive club suite which was huge and well appointed - disappointed with the club offerings at cocktail time as alcoholic drinks weren't gratis . We headed downstairs to the excellent bar where we met a Hollywood screenwriter and chatted for about 3 hrs -what a blast.Staff all very professional and another quality Sheraton offering

Reviews.Title: “An okay place to stay but the elevators are definitely a problem”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1322
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip, as with every trip, I check out trip advisor. I had read that the food was over priced and the elevators were an issue. We stayed here from July 3 to July 8th. We did not have any issues checking in. A bellman took our luggage and let me keep my car in front of the hotel until I got our bags out and checked in. We chose to self park. The parking is extremely close. From the reviews I had read, it sounded like it was farther away but it is very close and very convenient and I don't see why you would need a valet. We were on the 4th floor and our room faced the pool. I thought the room was clean and well serviced and never had any issues at all. The main floor/ lobby of the hotel is renovated and very nice and they have a concierge who, when they are there, is very helpful. You can purchase Universal park tickets on site and they are knowledgeable about any deals or savings. We wanted to purchase tickets with cash but could only use credit card and the man was willing to put on his credit card and we would pay him the cash. We used our credit card but that was going out of his way I thought. There is a lounge right across from check in. Down farther on the main floor are computers for anyone's use. I think there are at least 6 computers available and I used them at different times during the day and never had to wait. The gift store has various items, from gifts to books to items you may need such as nail clippers (which we did). We had club service, so it was very nice to be able to go up in the morning and have some breakfast and h'ors doevres from 5 to 9 pm. Yes there is a charge for alcohol but soft drinks are free. The only problem with this hotel and it is a HUGE problem are the elevators. They are truly awful and I was so thankful to be on the fourth floor because you could walk down two flights of stair and be at the lobby. Lobby is 3rd floor. Just like everyone writes... they take FOREVER and A DAY. We checked in on a Sunday night and after we were settled, we wanted to go to the club level, floor 9 and check it out. The elevator was full of people. It was elevator #2... we were trying to get to 9 and it was like it was trying to understand the message of the floors but couldn't quite get there. It went to 9, stopped but didn't open, then went to 7, then back to 9 (not opening but acting like it may be thinking about it) went up to 10, down to 5 and then to 9 and finally opened. It was AWFUL. I have never been so close to thinking I was going to be stuck in an elevator. We got out right away. We chose to take the stairs down to the lobby to check it out more. When we went to go back to our room... there was a maintenance man talk to the elevator door saying, "OK sir, I have called the repair people and they will be here shortly" According to hotel staff, he was stuck in there for 45 minutes. They reassured my family member that it was all fixed. The next morning I was back in there and lucky for me, #2. I was trying to go to one of the top floors and the same thing happened. I never stepped foot in #2 again. The elevators never once took 90 seconds. I waited up to 15 minutes most times. They have seats outside the elevator, for a reason I believe. You really need to use them because the elevators take so long. We did have lunch one day in the restaurant and it was fine. There is a grocery store very close and we purchased some beverages and snacks. It costs $22 for two beer delivered room service which is crazy when you can go to the store and purchase more than two for cheaper then that. Loved the pool, loved the shuttle to Universal. Really easy to access and very friendly drivers. Does get quite full as it services more then just that hotel, so I had to stand once but all in all, it was easy and free! One day I was trying to rush and catch the shuttle and I could see it start to drive away and so I stopped running and my body language showed I was disappointed. The driver saw me and stopped and waited for us. So that was very nice. The worst part about the hotel is the elevators and I would not stay here again because of the elevators. Very scary. There are several comments about the elevators, so Sheraton needs to pay attention to that because it is a deal breaker in my opinion. Otherwise this is a fine place to stay. Just need to fix the elevators. Pillows and beds very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “If your thinking of staying here, please read this first (awful experience) ...............”
Reviews.Author: JasonLT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Universal hotel on 07/02/2011 – 07/04/2001. The hotel stay was absolutely terrible. Please read on to see what you are in store for should you decide to stay at the Sheraton Universal. First of all, while checking in, the front desk clerk (Jason) failed to tell us about the evening hors d’oeuvres service (not a big deal initially, but it set the precedence for this hotel stay). I knew about the Club Level because I reserved a Club Level room. However, this hotel has Club Level floors and Preferred Guest Level floors. Although the floors look identical, they are labeled differently when getting off of the elevator which leaves a guest who reserves a room on the Club Level floor to believe they are getting less value of a room by having to stay on the Preferred Guest Level floor. The hotel put us on the Preferred Level floor so it was confusing to the front desk clerk (looking at his computer) as to what amenities were available to us. I asked him 3 times after checking in and he kept telling me that if I wanted evening hors d’oeuvres or breakfast, I’d have to go to the hotel restaurant (he kept looking at me as if I were trying to get a hotel service for free). This got me very confused and second guessed myself as to what level of room I had reserved. Next, most hotels offer complimentary beer and wine on the Club Level during the evening hors d’oeuvres service. Not this hotel. And that is hotel, in the club reception room, there are bottles of 5 beers and 2 wines on display on the appetizer table. There are sodas and bottled water right next to the alcoholic beverages display. However, there is no mention of those alcoholic beverages costing anything. No sign, no announcement, nothing at all. Even when the hostess came by to take a drink order, there was no verbal mention that there would be a fee for the alcoholic beverages. Once the hostess brings you the beverage, she brings you a check with the alcoholic beverages on it (and expects a tip on top of that). Now, what is the point of paying extra for a club level room if they are even going to expect a tip? Although most hotels offer complimentary beverages, beer, and wine at the evening hors d’oeuvres time, it is fine that this hotel does not. But at least inform the guest of such. Ok, so next problem. The elevator service is terrible. Before staying that this particular hotel, I read a review on this hotel that stated that the elevators took a guest 8 minutes to get from the ground floor to her room. After reading that, I thought to myself, “that cannot possibly be true. What an exaggeration”. However, on that particular review, the manager responded that he tested the elevator service and it should never take more than 90 seconds to hail an elevator. I thought, “that’s true”. However, believe it or not, that guest was correct! The first elevator trip to our floor after checking in took 13 minutes to arrive at the lobby level, not to mention a few additional minutes to get to our floor. The elevators could not handle the capacity of the guests, and once to capacity, seemed to bypass the lobby floor where the majority of guests were waiting to go to their rooms. If an elevator stopped at the lobby level, it was a miracle (and so crowded that only 1 or 2 guests could get into the elevator). I think the manager who responded to the previous guest’s review about the elevators was testing the elevators out at 3:00am in the morning. Next, we arrived in our room and it was facing the freeway (obviously noisy as heck). I called to request a room change (mind you, this is at 6:00pm) and I was told that the hotel was sold out and there was nothing they could do. I was told that maybe there would be rooms available tomorrow (Saturday) so I politely said to let me know in the morning. The front desk clerk said I would have to call back in the morning and inquire. Ok, so one more thing for me to do? I asked if they could simply call me and they said I’d have to call them and re-inquire. A few minutes later, I called back and said I definitely needed a room change. I was told someone would call back in 5 minutes. 20 minutes later, I called back since no once had called me. I was told that they were still searching for rooms (mind you, there were still tons of guests checking into the hotel so what the big deal was about a room swap was beyond me). They finally called back and said the only room they could fit me into was a standard room on the third floor (not a Club Level room) that faced the hotel parking structure. And when I say faced it, I mean you look out the window and you literally see a concrete wall in front of you with a little cement entrance road below. How disgusting and certainly a slap in the face. Was it intentional, I’ll let you decide? Read on and you’ll somehow agree that the culture of employees at this hotel are rude and not customer service oriented. So, we kept the room and moved on. We left for Universal City Walk at 8:00pm and stopped by the front desk on our way out. We spoke to the clerk who initially checked us in (Jason) and asked for a room refresh of towels and an evening turn down service. Jason looked up our room and stated he would take care of it. My wife even double confirmed the correct room number and Jason repeated our names back from the computer. So we thought we were set. Not so. We returned at midnight to find the room untouched. I called downstairs and was told there was no housekeeping staff on duty at midnight. Now come one, you’d think a hotel this size would at least one housekeeper on duty. I asked for a manager and was told there was not a manager on duty until 9:00am the following morning. Are you serious? No manager. Who is in charge if the hotel was on fire? I was told that there absolutely was no manager on duty and there was absolutely nothing they could do. They sent a maintenance type employee up to our room with a stack of towels. Period. They stated that they would email a manager and he would contact us at 9:00am sharp the following morning. I simply got a voice mail message on our phone (which I did not get until we returned from Universal Studios the following day at 5:00pm). The message simply stated along the lines of said “Hi, this is Chris Moraca, Front Desk Manager, I heard we had some issues last night. Please feel free to call me with any questions”. The next evening of our hotel stay (night 2), we left for the City Walk at about 6:30pm and called the front desk to request a room refreshing and turn down service again. They stated that there would be no problem with such a request. We returned at midnight to find the room untouched again. I called the front desk and was again told there was no housekeeping at that hour and no manager on duty. This is a Saturday night. What do you mean no manager on duty? It was the same front desk person I spoke to the previous evening (Leanne) and she could not believe what was happening. She apologized and stated that this was “completely unacceptable” for this hotel to treat a guest in this manner. She promised to have a manager call my cell phone the following morning (of which I received no call from a manager or supervisor). Furthermore, Leanne stated that the manager that she was emailing that evening was Holly and that Holly would be the person contacting me in the morning. I told her we had no shampoo or soap left and had to get up very early the next morning for a flight. She said she would have the items brought right up to our room. Ten minutes later, my wife called and asked where the items were. It was 1:00am and we could not be hanging out waiting for the items because we needed to get to sleep for an early morning flight the next day. We were then told that the items were not on their way because there were other guests that needed attention first and we would have to “wait our turn” in a line of requests. Finally, a hotel employee arrived again with a stack of towels and an entire bag for soap and shampoo. I mean, there had to be 20 bottles of mini shampoos and about 30 bars of soap. What point were they now trying to make? Finally, upon check out on Sunday morning (at 9:00am), there was one luggage valet available for approximately 7 – 10 parties waiting for his services downstairs. Thank goodness we did not have to have a luggage valet come to our room. It would have never happened. We were getting a bit anxious that no one was able to assist us with calling for a taxi so we went back into the hotel and visited the concierge desk. We asked him to help us get a taxi. Although he was helping no one, he said only the bell desk could help us. Come to find out, all the bell desk needed to do is push a doorbell style button once which signaled a taxi to come to the lobby entrance to pick us up. Are you telling me that the concierge could not walk over a few steps and push said button (or at least tell us how to push the button)? It would have saved so much waiting time and energy. All in all, this hotel is poorly managed, lacks proper training, and a disgrace to the Sheraton name. I have never wrote a review on anything in my life as they are very time consuming. However, in this instance, I felt compelled to because I have never been treated this way. And to wrap it up, to this date, there has been no call from management to address the happenings during this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really great staff! Helpful friendly and warm !”
Reviews.Author: MelanieJuly2011
Reviews.Content: Had a really great weekend there. It was my son's 8th birthday and everyone made the weekend extra special for him, including the timely delivery of a birthday cake for him with a birthday card from the hotel! The room was clean comfortable and had a great view. The staff could not have been better and the location made it easy to get to all the places we wanted to visit over the weekend. We will return....maybe for his 9th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robandwilson
Reviews.Content: Checking in was easy and everybody was friendly and helpful. Since we arrived early from Australia our room wasn't ready at 8am but the staff rushed around and were fantastic and let us in early, They could not have been more amazing, Bed was a great size and view was good, so close to walk up to city walk and having the blue line hop on hop off bus outside was AWESOME, Only downside the starbucks in lobby, could've been the worst coffee I have ever had, but can not fault Sheraton universal Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Belly2007
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was near to Universal Studios. However, everything here you need to pay additional for, such as internet in room, breakfast, and parking ($18/day, with in-out privileges) They had a good number of computers where you can surf the web for free at their business center downstairs but it's usually full during peak times. Fortunately I was jetlagged so I was down there by 4am and nobody would be competing with me for the computers :-) They also had in-room starbucks coffee, and free newspapers at the business center. All in all, average / ok hotel, no wow factor, wouldn't recommend or NOT recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if visiting Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Fox0597
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a visit to Unversal Studios, this is a good hotel to stay at. It's about a 10 minute walk to get to Universal Studios or the Citywalk from the hotel. I recommend booking club level. You get light snacks in the evening and a light breakfast in the morning. Don't expect too much for breakfast...not hot items to eat. If you're looking for a good breakfast, you'll likley need to dine at the restaurant on lower level. If you're planning on using the gym, it's a decent set-up consiting of treadmills, stationary bikes, dumbells, and strength equipment. The only issue I had was the lack of airflow. The morning I worked out it was very hot and the A/C didn't seem to be working.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tedoworld
Reviews.Content: I was there for a wedding in March. As a Platinum member, they upgraded me to a corner suite on one of the upper floors. Even so, Suite was sort of small.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: OC_M_Lu
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to watch the Playboy Jazz Fest at the Hollywood Bowl and thought it would be great to stay at the Sheraton due to the close distance to the Bowl. Check-in was a breeze; they allowed me to check in at noon even if technically we had to wait till 3pm. I requested a room close to the elevators on a higher floor and they gave it to me without a hassle. The room had a flat screen tv, coffeemaker, safe, iron and 2 phones (wireless phone doesn't work-battery light was blinking). Major stain on the carpet very close to the window- gross. Another problem was the A/C didn't function so well. It didn't feel cold, it just felt like a strong fan all night. We sort of expected (half-hoped) that they would have a shuttle to the Bowl; unfortunately it wasn't one of the stops so we just cabbed it. By the way, self-parking is $18 per day and valet is $23. Props to the valet guys-very friendly and cheerful even if the weather outside was dreadful and gray on that saturday afternoon. We had breakfast the next morning at Americanas which is located on the terrace level overlooking the pool. It wasn't very busy so we were seated right away. The buffet breakfast didn't look too appetizing so we asked for the lunch and dinner menus and I ended up ordering off the dinner menu. My ribeye turned out just the way I want it and my bf enjoyed his spinach and egg white omelet. We asked for plain bagel, unfortunately, at 11am they ran out of plain bagel and served us raisin cinnamon bagel and charged us $2 for the cream cheese. WE had a so-so experience at the sheraton - nothing really fantastic stood out. Will we go back and stay there again? Probably not. Maybe we'll try the Hilton next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for work and play”
Reviews.Author: FlyNurse365
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay during my birthday weekend and then for work the rest of the week. Everything was crisp and clean. The housekeeping was great in respecting my privacy as well as having everything fresh. This hotel was a perfect distance from universal and staying away from the spotlight. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here and will return again”
Reviews.Author: shawniegirl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night at the start of our honeymoon. Checking in was easy and everybody was friendly and helpful. Since we arrived early our room wasn't ready but the desk agent gave us a key to a lower room (no view) and said if we were okay we could have that room or else wait for our room with a view. Well since we were not there for the view we checked out the lower room and it was fine. We went back to the agent told him it was okay and so he upgraded us from that room to a low floor with the pool view which I thought was way better then the room we were supposed to have because this had a balcony. Also, since it was our honeymoon they gave us a comp breakfast coupon. The property is very nice as you would expect for a Sheraton. Location was perfect for going to Universal Studios. Short walk or you can catch their shuttle. Conciege desk was very helpful in giving us ideas for things to see along with maps on how to get there. The bell desk was helpful and valet parking guys were great and even wiped down our windows for us. I have no problems recommending this hotel to other and would gladly stay here again. If I had to find something negative to say I'd say it was finding our room the first time. To get to the lower level rooms you have to go down the hall (passing rooms) to an elevator. There is no sign on the outside saying elevator down the hall. So we walked down the hall as that was the directions given, saw rooms and figured it was the wrong way so turned around before getting to the elevator. Then after checking all areas we asked again and was told to pass the rooms to find the elevator. It wasn't bad just confusing and something to laugh about as we should have trusted the first directions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: gregj2209
Reviews.Content: The Universal Sheraton was excellent. The location is very good and significantly better than I'd anticipated. Obviously it's very close to Universal Studios and Citywalk, which is a big bonus. There's a metro stop just down the hill, which is very handy and Disneyland is a very, very easy drive. If you don't mind using the metro it's very handy. The service in the hotel was superb - I can't speak highly enough of the concierge service, especially the lady whose name I have unfotunately forgotten. They were able to book basketball tickets, arrange a hire car, give us all sorts of help and advice, directions, you can buy Universal Studios tickets (front of line pass) there and I could go on and on. Our most sincere thanks go to them, the best concierge desk I've experienced. In fact all the staff were excellent - just one example was that there was an LAPD conference on a couple of the days we were there and when the queue for lifts was extremely long the security guard took us up in the service elevator so we didn't have to wait!! Genuinely one of the kindest gestures I've ever received in a hotel. I'd highly recommend this hotel, the rooms were spacious and comfortable and the service was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: zev0n
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Universal for 2 nights in mid-April 2011 with my mother and young kids (aged 8 & 5). It was so close to Universal Studios! Absolutely fantastic. To get to Universal, you can cross the street & head into the parking garage to take the escalators all the way to the park entrance, or you can walk up the hill and cross the pedestrian bridge. The metro (subway) is just down the hill and across the street and it takes you right to the Chinese Theatre and Hollywood Walk of Fame. Perfect location. The beds were clean and our room was ready even though we arrived before lunch. Staff were friendly. The pool was nice but shady in the evening. I only had 3 negatives ~ (1) no fridge in the room (2) our room faced the road and freeway so it was very, very loud at night (2) the restaurant was very expensive for breakfast and nothing was open in Universal City....a staff recommended a family run restaurant which was cheap & great, but we had to walk a very long way to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch from the outset!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adrianjaneb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a day before travelling. My husband booked over the phone via the reservation number. We didnt receive a confirmation email to confirn our booking, I heard him spell out our surname and i heard him spell out our email address not once but TWICE............ Check in - Because we didnt receive our confirmation number via email the lady we checked in with was very rude, if you dont have your confirmation number we can not help you, OUCH!!!!! eventually she found it after alot of huffing and puffing...... We had to pay for parking which is a total b........t cost after the price they charged for the room....... The room was very spacious considering we were travelling with a family of 5 (3 young kids). I dont even know if they had a restaurant as we didnt want to spend any additional money in the hotel after the service we received for reservation/check in. I mentioned this hotel to a friend of mine who was considering staying here and they immediately reconsidered another option. The only positive was it was close to Universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffery1
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Universal was a great hotel to stay at! My husband and I, along with a friend of ours booked 2 rooms for 2 nights so we we would be close to Universal Studios. We booked our rooms through Priceline (after shopping different sites and even calling the hotel itself) and got the best deal. When we arrived we found that our 2 rooms were on different floors, which wasn't that big of a deal - but the wonderful woman at the check-in desk went out of her way to find us 2 rooms on the same floor, that were right across the hall from each other. We meant to go back and get her name but we never saw her again. Just about everything to do with the hotel was wonderful. -The rooms were very clean (and we got a view of the park) -The bathrooms were clean and the water pressure was great! - There was a coffee pot in the room with STARBUCKS coffee and Tazo tea! a HUGE deal to me. -The entire staff was great! The valet people in the front were so nice! They joked around with us when we were coming in and leaving and helped us with walking directions (and we didn't valet, we just parked in the garage, but they were nice and helpful anyway and always smiling). - The people who worked the desk were friendly and helpful - Room service was speedy and our order was right. :) - The hotel is right across the street from Universal Studios and down the block from the subway station (which we walked to so we could catch the train to downtown and go shopping, see the walk of fame etc. etc and the Hollywood sign is visible from the Mall if you go to the top floor). -Housekeeping was great (we left them $5 a day - you should always tip everyday because you might get a different housekeeper at the end of your stay so if you tip only when you check out, you may have stiffed the person that cleaned your room most of your stay!) -There is a bar in the lobby which was great after a day walking around and also a convenience store in case you forgot anything -There is an outdoor pool, which we didn't use, but it looked nice clean (our friend had a view of the pool and the hills) -The overall hotel was clean and well maintained. We would definitely stay here again. Not only are you close to Universal and the Subway, but you are a short drive or cab ride to lots of other attractions. The ONLY bad thing we encountered in the hotel, and this only applies to my husband and I, not our friend, who had no issues whatsoever.... was that in the middle of the night our air-conditioner stopped working! The fan was going but warm air was blowing out... we both woke up very hot and the room was very very stuffy. It was the last day of our stay and it was the middle of the night - it wan't that big of a deal (although it was a little hard to sleep) so we didn't bother calling the front desk. The room was back to normal when we woke up and then we were checking out anyway. No biggie. I'm sure if we would have called someone, it would have been fixed in no time. But that's it... just one little tiny issue that did not ruin my vacation. :) We had a great time and we will be back! Oh and for those out there that complain about having to pay to park - good luck finding a decent hotel in California where you don't have to pay. We didn't mind having to pay to park - your car is in a nice garage, guard gated and it's right next to the hotel - no problems getting in or out, and once you pay, you can come and go all day long if you want.

Reviews.Title: “the best concierge in LA”
Reviews.Author: trishnick
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful. The resturant waiters were exceptional but the concierge "Fernando" deserves a pay rise as he is a man of unbelievable knowledge. The hotel is located very close to Universal and subway with lots of resturants nearby at universal walk. Beds are very comfortable but do not get rooms that have interconnecting doors as you can hear what is happening next door. Hotel is clean but cleaners need to clean more behind bed and curtains as there is a fair bit of dust built up behind these areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool0879
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for access to universal studios and all the highways. Was also only a 5 min downhill walk to the subway so that you can access all the sights of LA. The staff were very helpful and helped us to book lots of trips and visits and were always quick with advice and tips so that we had a brilliant 6 day stay in LA and feel we saw everything there was to see

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smoke free, hotel, definately not”
Reviews.Author: willowMelbourne
Reviews.Content: One of my daughters is Asthmatic, and i would never return to this hotel, with her. Though the rooms are meant to be smoke free, they smell of smoke, admitedly not as much as the corridor or entrance area, so if a smoke free environment is necessary this is not the hotel for you. Its close proximety to Universal Studios was our reason for booking, unfortunately it did not live up to our expectations, as the sheets were torn or stained and the water did hot flow down the plug hole but built up in the bath. The restaurant is worth mentioning, food was great, the staff were attentive and listened to our needs. I do recommend eating here rather then at Universal. I also appreciated the Bell staff, their sunny but professional approach, and care they took with our baggage, was exemplery.

Reviews.Title: “The Elevators and Thin Walls will make you crazy”
Reviews.Author: KGolf14
Reviews.Content: Just spent nine nights at the Sheraton Universal. Part of my trip was planned , part was due to a family emergency. The front desk , valet and bar lounge staff was very helpful and attentive but the rest of my hotel experience was very disappointing. Several days I waited over 20 minutes for the elevator. My first night the voices, noises and smoke from the room next store made it impossible to sleep. Most nights I heard all the conversations going on in the room next store. I am a Starwood Elite Vacation Owner and an avid Starwood user. This will be my last stay at this Hotel. I would rather stay at the Westin at Lax or a hotel near Burbank.

Reviews.Title: “Great Except the Dirty Bed”
Reviews.Author: DrDSM
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was great, almost everything you would expect for a conference facility. The staff was friendly, hotel seemed in good shape, fitness room was well equipped, room was clean, 14th floor room had a great view and was clean, great A/V staff. All was great until I was packing my suitcase and pulled back the bed sheet. The bed seams were full of black residue ( see pictures below). We were running out to LAX so I did not have time to mention it to the manager. Absolutely disgusting. I'm just glad I didn't get bed bugs. Also, the chairs for the convention could use updating. Everyone of my colleagues complained about them and how their backs were hurting.

Reviews.Title: “mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: travelling1935
Reviews.Content: I have stayed occasionally at the Sheraton Universal over the years, and I have to say that in spite of recent substantial renovations, the hotel is feeling a bit tired. On my last two-night visit, I was on a high floor with spectacular views, and had a comfortable night's sleep on a most comfortable bed. The check-in was pleasant and attentive. Questions were answered knowledgably and courteously. The lobby was as attractive as I always remembered it, but with no real sitting area unless you went into the bar section. The decor in soft beige tints was pleasant both upstairs and down. Self-parking was good value at $18 per 24 hours, as was the internet. Yet, there was also a motor hotel feel feel which was new and unwelcome. The room maintenance was bizarre in my case. It was no more than perfunctory, if that. After my first night I returned to the room after several hours away and found that the bed covers had simply been pulled up — and not much more. Dust balls on the carpet evident when I checked in were still there 24 hours later. In the bathroom, I had left one towel in the tub because it needed replacing. When I returned it was now on the bathroom floor, along with the bath mat which I had carefully folded and draped over the tub in the morning. There was soap scum in the wash basin. Also. I suspect that easy access to restaurants up the hill on City Walk has had a negative effect on food services at the Sheraton Universal. Again, the staff in the sole remaining restaurant was pleasant and attentive, although not especially professional. But it was essentially a coffee-shop menu and coffee-shop quality food. However, the tortilla soup can be recommended. For breakfast, unless you want a traditional repast, the coffee and Danish bar in the bar area is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Still as BAD”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not good the last time we stayed, some 4 years ago. Well it is now even worse. Plumbing not working, both sink and toilet not flowing away. It took 11 hours for the engineer to attend to these small matters. Very noisy maids trolleys going along at 5.30am, and maid service that would do justice to the average prison. Yes the beds are very comfortable but with all the noise what is the point. Next trip it will be up the hill to the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - old hotel, but in nice shape”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTravelCoord
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days last month and enjoyed it- The hotel seemed to be well maintained, and the staff was very professional and helpful. The Concierge was able to make dinner recommendation for restaurants NOT on the City Walk, and the bellmen were always ready to help any way they could.
