Two people made my stay extra special; the housekeeper on my floor who lit up each morning I passed her and wanted to know how I was doing, and the Club Room attendant at breakfast, who wanted to make sure I had everything I could possible want for breakfast. On my last day, the Club Room attendant said she was going to miss me, and hoped I would be back soon. I hope so! The bar also makes a great mojito! The other selections are very good as well. The only down sides were: The hotel restaurant. The menu looks like it came from the "My First Restaurant" kit: Salmon, steak, chicken, Caesar salad... The food tasted very basic as well. And the parking- about 20 bucks a day!

Reviews.Title: “What a major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Jbunster
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, beautiful lobby, great exercise room .... and nothing else. Our first room was on the 20th floor. Carpet was stained and M&M's were left in a few spots on the carpet. Obviously a great cleaning job by housekeeping. On Friday night, there was a band playing for a wedding directly above our room. It was too loud to talk! The management was surprised we found this disturbing but eventually moved us to another room. The bell hop told us it was this way every weekend night! Overall, this hotel was a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel for Universal Studios trip”
Reviews.Author: Norgetroll
Reviews.Content: Lat stayed here two years ago. Hotel is still IMO the best play when visiting Universal Studios. The park is in walking distance and the hotel shuttle runs daily from 9am to 8pm. We never waited for more than 5 minutes . Hotel staff are very friendly. Plenty of bell men to get your bags. No line at check in, arrived at 8pm. We ate in the bar area, which is generally quiet. food was tasty and service friendly. We were in room on 10 floor. View of pool and hills. 2 queens with a sitting area. Perfect size for family of 4. Decor was nice and room very clean. Had Club privaliges. This is the only area we noticed any changes.Breakfast was fine but not as good as last time. The small single juice bottles in several varities were gone. Instead just a large Orange juice pitcher. No more single serve cereals and strawberries were only put out once. Evening service like wise was scaled back. Some veggies, dip, and chicken wings. Pool area is nice, with plenty of chairs and towels. The pool though is not heated, which made it impossible to swim in. Internet is still not free. $.9.99 a day. And self park is $18 a day. Still a nice hotel and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated except corners”
Reviews.Author: SKW66
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their cheapest King bed room for around $100 booked through Hotwire. Pros: - Received really nice service from the bell boy (man, actually) who showed genuine friendliness that made us feel that he really wanted us to have a pleasant stay from his heart. When he found that we were staying for 10 days, he offered to bring us a mini-fridge just in case. It's complementary anyway, but his service was really superb. Too bad I am not good at remembering names that I could have given him credits here. - 70% of the hotel had been renovated. E.g. wall papers, bedside cabinets, etc. - Couldn't request for a King bed room before arrival and hence we could only use a room in the same floor of the front desk. But since the hotel's big and the room was located furthest from the front desk, we did not find this much of a concern at all. - Computers in the business center were all new models (new at least to a computer idiot like me) with speedy internet. Before we arrived, we read the earlier review saying that the computers in the business center were not working properly. But during the 10 days of our stay, we did not see any of this happened and made good use of them. So it was still fine without free in-room wi-fi. - They offered $5 voucher each day we declined housekeeping service. Hence we'd collected vouchers worth a total of $30. We used them all at one go and enjoyed a breakfast in the hotel on the last day. (Though don't expect too much on the food...) Cons: - The only 2 mirrors in the room were located inconveniently. The biggest one was in the bathroom but there was no way I could lean closer to look at my face clearly as the bathroom was really small. Another mirror was located inside the closet. Since we have 4 big luggages, one of them was put inside the side right in front of the mirror ('cause no where else in the room could we have put it instead). And with the dim lighting next to the closet, it was still hard for me to try to put some make-up on. And we had been wondering why the mirror was not placed behind the working desk where there was a really big empty wall. - While every thing seemed to be pretty new, spider's web was found in the ceiling corner in the bedroom. Mold was also found at the ceiling corner at the bath tub. And the door lock was obviously not replaced after renovation and looked quite dirty and old. - Is it how the blankets are arranged in hotels now? We have a thick bed cover over a down blanket over a thin bed sheet. All these 3 items are just loosely covering in layers without any thing holding them together. Every morning the 3 blankets went different paths and it was really not comfortable to find yourself directly covered by the down blanket when you woke up in the morning. - With a flat screen TV already in place, the hotel at a level like Sheraton should really consider incorporating the HD features. - Traveling to Universal Studio/ City Walk from the hotel was not meant to be done by walk. Either you catch the shuttle or drive there yourself. We wanted to watch a movie past 8pm at one night but the shuttle was already off. We had to pay $10 for parking in the City Walk while we were supposed to be staying in the hotel at Universal Studio.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: peteleedds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 evenings. Front desk, bell hop were not friendly at all. Ordered room service four times but they did not get my order right 3 times. Ordered an omelette, but no salt or pepper. Called room service to complain, their response, "you never mentioned salt and pepper." Ordered coffee, but only got a mug. Was told internet service was free, called before to make sure. I was then charged $9.95 ten times. I used valet parked for one day only but I was charged for 4! Was annoyed by the noise caused by the ice machine next to my door. Never got a good night's sleep. Called customer service to complain about these charges but agent kept putting me on hold. Then got transferred to accounting department but no response. No call back. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Has improved a bit, still room for more though !”
Reviews.Author: swills9
Reviews.Content: We ahve stayed at this Hotel for 3 years in a row now, (could be 4 !) each year it has go better, but there is still room for improvement, It has had a refurb, although I am not 100% certain the room we had in FEB/MARCH2010 had been done or not, as there was a lot of mechanical noise overnight, The other problem we had was there were a couple of conventions during our stay, and was VERY noisy at 1 in the morning, with the 'reveller's' going back to the rooms, I stuck my head out for the door to see what the nosie was, and the stink of booze was very strong!... mad eme tipsy and I had not been drinking! Staf were very friendly tho, and tried to assist on various things, but with it full not a lot they could do, and the Cra Park cost was abit of a surprise and costly ! I did complain to the Hotel, and they did say they would make it up to us on the next visit, but of course by the time we go back in November 2011 they wil of course forgotten due to the length of time ! :-) But the UK to LA is a long way and expensive ! All in all the Hotel is good, great for UNIVERSAL and close to Metro too. Just be careful if there are any conventions, as it may also take a bit of time to get access to a lift!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay and Still Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: stevelieb
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent corporate business traveler, I really look for comfort and service when I am away from home and my family. This is my second recent stay at the Sheraton Universal, and I am still convinced that this is a great property. The aromatherapy scent that is common in all Starwood properties greets you when you enter the lobby. I was upgraded to a nice sized room with a king bed on the Club floor. The room was freezing cold when I checked in, but when I called the operator a hotel engineer contacted me immediately. He came upstairs and got the heater working-I just wish I remembered his name because he was very professional and made sure I was satisfied with the situation before he left. The 9th floor lounge is well appointed and offers an evening reception with beer and wine for sale, along with light appetizers as well as a free continental breakfast in the morning. After getting caught up on emails, I was not motivated to leave the hotel for dinner and ate downstairs in the restaurant. While nothing on the menu jumped out at me, the chicken with tossed parmesan asparagus was delicious. I look forward to returning on my next trip down the coast.

Reviews.Title: “Plusses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd or 3rd visit to this property and my first since the renovation. Even as a repeat visitor, it's hard to find the entrance to this hotel. Staff check in was fast and friendly. I was upgraded to an "Executive" room which was basically a large junior suite. The room had nice/new Sheraton furnishings, but the new-ish flatscreen tv was way too small for the room/the way it was positioned (too far from the bed or sofa to see). The main problem with the hotel in the guest room as well as in the Terrace Room where I attended a cocktail reception was the lack of functioning A/C. I think the management is aware of this issue (as evidenced by the fan placed in the room at check in). The room wasn't terrible, but the ballroom was unbearable. People were sweating in their gowns and suits and constantly stepping out to breathe. Room service was fast and delicious. The lobby bar was a great place to catch up with an old friend. Good beers on tap, great cocktails, good service. Valet was fast. The only other problem (potentially a deal breaker if you're here on vacation) is that the elevators were woefully below the hotel's capacity. I'd wait 5-10 minutes on average. (To be fair, there were 2 events in the hotel and it was a busy Saturday night) but a trip to/from your room shouldn't take 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip to Universal”
Reviews.Author: fhata
Reviews.Content: Booked a AAA Travel package to the Sheraton Universal for two nights. We arrived just before noon and was able to check into a room right away. The service was great with our bellman offering a free fridge for all of our snacks/drinks that we brought. Parking for our car was included in the package, but runs around $18.00 for self parking. The room was located on the 17th floor with a nice view of the park. Although small, our accomodations seemed recently remodeled and clean. We quickly unpacked and headed to the park. By foot, you first take an elevator up to the next level (where the Hilton is) and then take a short uphill hike to the park. Total time about 15 minutes. There is a shuttle that picks up at the Sheraton but we never used it. Universal was not packed during our stay, and we easily covered everything in the two days. One evening we took the Metro to Hollywood/Highland (one stop from Universal Station) to see the Graumans Chinese Theater and the sights. On the return trip back to Universal Station there is a bit of an uphill walk to the Sheraton. It seemed safe as there were others walking. The next morning we decided to try their buffet breakfast downstairs and it was one of the best buffets we've had in a long time. Although not cheap (around $25.00/person) we enjoyed the breakfast faire. The big breakfast precluded us from eating much in the park that day until we had dinner that evening. That evening we spent at the City Walk next to the park. The recent acquisition of the Sheraton Universal by the Shenzhen group may bring some interesting changes to the Hotel. As a Starwood member we would definitely consider staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here”
Reviews.Author: MandMWorld
Reviews.Content: Great location but noisy and not very well maintained. Had problem with Toilet always running,reported it and nothing happened. Rooms very small, no hanging space for clothes. Only one resturaurnt with limited menu.

Reviews.Title: “A little frustrating”
Reviews.Author: BuddyMalloy
Reviews.Content: Was here on business for 2 nights, a few observations. The outside looks like nothing special but the inside has been redone. TMy first thought was that it looked pretty good. But... The pluses: - All staff were extremely friendly, at all times. - It is located within walking distance of Universal Studios and City Walk (but there's a shuttle anyway as some of the walk is uphill). - The hotel has an area with a number of computers for free use, including internet access. - hotel was quiet. The negatives: - The computer centre was not working 9 out of my 10 trips to it. When I finally mentioned it at the Front Desk, they were nice but completely unconcerned and it was never fixed for the rest of my stay. I saw others get up and leave the computer centre in frustration. - My 'recently renovated' CLUB floor room had stains everywhere - on the bed, on the drapes, on the literature. - room had plastic cups - no fridge or mini-bar (I really felt this was odd considering I was on the club floor) - The pay per view movies on the tv would not come up. - Could not access the "current account balance" - ever. - The restaurant closes before 6:30, leaving only the bar area on the main floor. The bar area is nice, the staff are great, but I thought the food was awful. - Conceirge gave me incorrect information (I was told a shuttle to the airport is $20.00...ah, I wish). - Bill was incorrect at check out and I had to get manager's assistance to straighten it out (completely their error - they were apologetic but the mistake was so unncessary). Keep in mind this hotel is not a cab ride from the airport (that's over $100.00). So you should rent a vehicle. It's too bad, with a little work and attention to detail, this could be a great place. I plan to take my family to Universal Studios soon, but I will be staying at the Hilton right next door. I didn't get a chance to visit it, but something tells me it's got to be better.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing service”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: As flights from Australia arrive into LAX early in the morning, I contacted the hotel quite a while in advance and requested early check in. We booked 3 rooms and requested them all to be together. I communicated with a lovely man from the hotel before our trip and he sounded so positive and helpful. Of course upon arrival (with 4 feral children!) NONE of our rooms were ready and the receptionist didn't try to help us at all. A very dissapointing arrival. The rooms however are lovely and the beds are extremely comfortable. During our 3 days we never saw the shuttle bus to Universal Studios and this was a huge problem as I have multiple sclerosis. The walk is just too far and difficult (for anyone really!). Taxi drivers got really annoyed at us because the drive was too short. The Hilton is definately closer and an easier walk. Next time I would stay there as it is much more convenient. I wish other reviewers mentioned that! It is definately worth getting the club lounge as the continental breakfast is lovely and fresh. I would also like to mention that I left a US$250 brand new tracksuit on the bed as I left. I was silly to not check the room before I left. There were kids running around and we were running late so it's my fault. We phoned the hotel 1 hour later and were put through to lost property. They found nothing. We phoned again the next day and spoke to reception and lost property again - once again, nothing. Very sad that someone would find it and keep it.
